Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 0v3rkill
Reviews.Content: Getting out of the cab i was a little nervous about the the extermely packed bar across the street, but once inside i couldnt hear a thing. This hotel was beautiful and clean. The rooms were nicely furnished and the beds really comfortable. Its probably the fastest i ever slept.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: norajay
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights prior to spending a week at the W. There location is really great, central but a bit away from the noisy bigger streets. It is located in the warehouse district where there are practically no tall buildings. The hotel is surrounded with very interesting art galleries, all of them worth a visit. The lobby and the inner patios are really pleasant to hang out in. We were given a room with a view of the inner patio witch made it really quiet. Over all, the hotel was really quiet. The room was spatious and the free wifi was really appreciated. The minibar was not stocked si we could cool our own drinks. There is a small pool on the roof top, with a few sun beds. It gets crowded very quickly. Since all the buildings are of the same height, it was always sunny. (with the bigger hotels you get always the shade form the skyscrapers around them and it is really annoying). Across the street - Lucy's is a very popular and fun hangout. And they make really nice breakfast. If you walk slowly, you can get to the French Quarter in about 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Another great pre-cruise stay @ the Renaissance Arts!”
Reviews.Author: hfitzger
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel before our Carnival Conquest cruise last week and had another great stay. In 2009, we stayed here pre-cruise and hoped that we would have the same wonderful experience as before again-- we did! I had booked using rewards points and was expecting a standard room-- what a surprise to find that we had been upgraded to a huge suite overlooking the inside courtyard area. The room was spotless, spacious, and beautifully decorated. (Having a hotel room with 2 televisions and 2 bathrooms was the icing on the cake for traveling with kids!) The hotel is gorgeous inside with the "arts" theme, and the staff is also friendly. We have stayed at some boutique hotels in large cities where the decor is the focus and not the personnel, but the Renaissance Arts has them both covered beautifully! The hotel location is ideal in that it is away from all of the noise and crowds of the French Quarter, yet it is within walking distance. The riverfront area and Harrah's are also nearby... For those of you who are cruising and looking to save a few $$, we were able to walk to the port with our luggage and save the $7/per person taxi fare to the cruise terminal. It is a few blocks, but if our kids could handle it, it is an option for those who don't mind walking and pulling suitcases behind in order to avoid a high fare for such a short distance to the port!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: srcaOntario
Reviews.Content: Quick elevators, beautiful hotel, friendly staff, no complaints at all. Beautiful brick wall in the hotel room. About a 15 minute walk to Jackson Square in the French Quarter. Would stay here again while in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific value”
Reviews.Author: andyBK_11
Reviews.Content: A real bargain with great service in a cool (for a Marriott) hotel. The hotel is in the hip Warehouse district within walking distance of a lot to see and do. Highly recommend the stay for breakfast rate as the buffet is great. Loved those grits. Miniscule rooftop pool but perfectly nice.

Reviews.Title: “What a nice surprise this property is!”
Reviews.Author: Anne B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property for the first two days prior to the NCAA Final Four. I had been looking at this hotel on line, and was intrigued by what I saw. I was able to book it on the Marriott site on Monday prior to our arrival on Wednesday. My fiancee was a coach and needed to attend the coaches convention which was being held at the Convention Center and the Hilton. This was my first time to New Orleans, and this hotel did not disappoint. I had read some reviews of this hotel which were not 100% positive, and I was a little concerned, but the price was right and it was down the street from where we needed to be. When we arrived, we were pleasantly surprised. I've stayed and hundreds of "traditional" Marriott properties, so I am always excited when I find one that isn't "just like all the others." We checked in and they had upgraded us to one of the suites on the 4th floor. The outside hallway makes it look like you are entering the outside of a house. Each room even had a doorbell. The room was immaculate, and while the bathroom was small, it didn't matter because we had two as well as a living room area. Our room overlooked the courtyard area. We would stay here again without question. This hotel is unique, close to everything, but not in the middle of everything. The staff was friendly and helpful. We did try to add 4 nights to our stay, but the rate (because of the Final Four) were triple what we were paying so chose to move to another Marriott property in Metairie. We used the concierge lounge on two mornings. It is a small lounge, and opens and closes, and removes food precisely at the time it says, not one minute more. The roof top pool is great. You can see all over the city which is fun. However the pool itself is very small. The workout room is excellent and provides multiple options. You do NOT need a car at this property (or in New Orleans for that matter) as parking is at a premium and valet parking is very expensive here. The blocks are short and you can walk to the convention center, Harrah's, Riverwalk and multiple restaurants easily. All are within about a 10 minute walk. We ate desert in the restaurant which was great, and they even have rootbeer floats which you don't often see on any hotel menus. They stock the showers and bath with Aveda products, and the beds are very comfortable. If we are back here again we will certainly consider staying here. I only wished we could have afforded to stay for the entire weekend. If you are looking for late night food, the Ernst Cafe is a bar that serves great burgers and chicken sandwiches (about 4 or so blocks away). We got in late and were hungry, the two bars which are on the same street were not what we were looking for (loud and bar food), and the bummer was the restaurants all stopped serving at 10AM on the weeknights. Which sort of surprised me since we were in a city which I thought would be open "all night"

Reviews.Title: “Nice location..but service was just "okay"”
Reviews.Author: Alexiaann
Reviews.Content: The art is beautifully displayed inside this hotel. The hotel is located in the warehose district and in walking distance to restuarants and shopping. The staff was less than attentative and service was "spotty". Carpet in my room was soiled and in need of cleaning.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: atlcharm
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic and located in an ideal location (Warehouse district). It close enough to the French Quarter to walk but far away enough to be a retreat from the mess! The hotel is immaculate and beautiful. I found the beds to be comfortable and well appointed. The towels provided were also plush. Please visit the rooftop pool and hottub; it gives a great view of the city. I'd stay here again when I can't afford the Ritz :)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely surprise hotel”
Reviews.Author: dreamtraveler4
Reviews.Content: We bid on priceline for a hotel in the warehouse district so had no input into which hotel other than price. We got the Renaissance and it was a wonderful surprise! Beautiful in a fresh, brightly colored decor - the artwork around the hotel is very interesting and atypcial for hotels. The lobby is scented with something that smelled fresh and inviting! The rooms were appointed nicely, and the bed was divine! We'd consider buying one of their beds for our home!! Location was good for us - near WW II Museum, and close enough to walk to restaurants in the French Quarter. And it was very, very quiet! We'd definitely recommend this hotel for the quality it has, the friendly service, and it's location.

Reviews.Title: “Overall it's nice however......”
Reviews.Author: peteb201
Reviews.Content: This property is a 10 minute walk to the middle of the convention center & 15 min walk to bourbon street also the casino is about 6 mins by foot. The rooms are nice and beds are comfy as well. So here is my problem. I had an early morning flight and had to be at airport for 515am. I went to the valet and asked how I can arrange for a cab that early. He took my name and room info and told mere would have a car waiting for me. Woke up in the morning,got dressed and walked to the entrance and could see it was pouring rain out. So walked out and waited for a good 15 mins and no car. The lobby was all dark so I called a cab on my own and made it to airport with no problem. So your asking yourself what's the problem? Well I contacted hotel and spoke to manager and all he had to say it sounded like a scam! You should have come inside to the front desk and we would have made arrangements for you and that valet are outsourced. My response to that is when you have someone out front with a name tag greeting guests then he is a extension of you and represents the property. You should of just said I'm sorry and I will take a look into it. Instead you didn't really care. Show some leadership because I will tell you now that it just shows how much Marriott cares about its clients . If you want to be treated well take my word this place is comfy but your just a number like most otherMarriott properties where status is nothing. If you can I recommend the W on Poydras much nicer stay and the staff cares! And one last thing to the manager your in New Orleans give people a reason to comeback besides for mardi gras and jazz fest. Because your treatment sure won't .

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing - This Hotel Has Gone Downhill”
Reviews.Author: Alexjrosen
Reviews.Content: Several years ago, I stayed at the Renaissance Arts and found it to be one of the best hotels in New Orleans. So I was anxious to stay there again when I went to New Orleans a couple weeks ago. Unfortunately it was not at all what I remembered. I requested a platinum upgrade on check-in but was told no suites were available, only an executive king. I was told the executive king rooms had their own individual internet connections. When I got to my room, the internet service was not working. I contacted the number provided for support, and after sitting on hold for 20 minutes or so, was told they could not help me and to call the front desk. The front desk knew nothing and did not offer any real solution. I asked, then, to change rooms. It was funny to me that the agent didn't offer to send the bellman up with the keys - instead she told me to come downstairs. In my new room, the toilet immediately stopped up and ran all night. This room also lacked an in-room safe, something I always utilize and something I never find absent from a hotel room. The room had so much empty space as well - it was as if it needed additional furniture or something. I ordered dinner with room service - the NY Strip Steak. I ordered it rare; the steak arrived Medium to Medium-Well, and the potatoes were cold. Not good for a $50 meal. Overall, this hotel was quite disappointing. At best, its a three-star.

Reviews.Title: “Great value. Great location. Hard to park.”
Reviews.Author: isturiz
Reviews.Content: Great value at $97. Well appointed, spacious, and in a great location. Walking distance to the French Quarter but away from the noise and traffic. Expect to pay at least $28 to park overnight.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful public space, ordinary rooms”
Reviews.Author: abcpoet
Reviews.Content: This hotel proved a bit less expensive than comparable 4 stars. It is a nice size, in the warehouse district, but only 4 blocks from canal street. (On the same street as restaurant August!). I would stay here again. The rooms have refrigerators--some face out, some face the courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! I will be back!!”
Reviews.Author: CocoJ28
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at Renaissance Arts Hotel. The room was modern, clean, and spacious. The hotel was within walking distance to the French Quater but far enough away to not be in all the craziness. I only had one issue with the toilet not working in my room when I first arrived at my room but the front desk quickly sent up a maintenance man to repair it within 20 mins of me calling. Overall a great stay and I will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful fun trip to Mardi Gras”
Reviews.Author: Upmyalley
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the Rennaissance Arts Hotel. Upon check-in they told us we were upgraded from a regular room to a wonderful suite. The staff was superb, Corey the bellman brought us to our room and welcome us to his house & told us if we needed anything to call him. . Everything was immaculate. We asked for an extra blanket and it was there in no time with a smile. All of this was done with a hotel that was at capacity. We were there for Mardi Gras and to our surprise most of the parades were routed unexpectedly in front of the hotel. After the parades the staff was sweeping the sidewalks immediately. This hotel is in the Warehouse District with many wonderful restaurants, art galleries, museums within walking distance. We had a pleasant walk to the parades on St. Charles Ave and loved hollering "Throw me something Mister". The neighborhood and location is very safe and we felt very comfortable walking everywhere. Wish we could have stayed longer, but we were headed to "Oak Alley Plantation" in Vacherie, LA. What a breathtaking view and beautiful property. We look forward to our return to the Renaissance Arts Hotel in the future. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott does it right in new orleans”
Reviews.Author: josh m
Reviews.Content: Good location. Walking distance to convention center. Its a long walk to bourbon 10plus blocks. Newer hotel with a little flair for the arts. Bar area is trendy and has a lounge feel. Rooms we're spacious. Staff was very freindly and helpfull. Fitness room had good equip. Pool and hot tub. The hotel had it all wasn't lacking in any area.

Reviews.Title: “They make the Big Easy so easy to love !!”
Reviews.Author: mywayonthehighway
Reviews.Content: We came to New Orleans on business during the week before Mardi Gras and wanted something close to the Quarter, but not in the midst of the craziness. This hotel is perfect, only a few blocks from the action. The staff is fabulous, from the valets (Travis) to the front desk & room service. The rooms are spacious, modern and extremely comfortable. And the piece d'resistance -- the rooftop pool & deck. It's worth staying here, just for the experience of this oasis in a urban environment. We couldn't have been more pleasantly surprised. The only negative is the fact that you have to valet park & it's rather pricey. But, I think this is pretty much the rule rather than the exception when staying in the Garden District/Quarter. Trust me, this place is wonderful and you'll have a great experience in the Big Easy.

Reviews.Title: “The Bomb”
Reviews.Author: dabax
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited NOLA in July/August 2011. We were there for the National Junior Olympics. The Renaissance Arts Hotel was out of sight. First, when we arrived at the hotel, the lady that assisted us at the check-in counter was very gracious. She got us checked in and situated and a very timely manner. Upon arriving to our room, we were pleasantly suprised that it was extremely spacious. The bathroom was clean and the entire room remained spotless due to a very attentive staff. Each morning I went to the very well suited workout facility to get in 45 minutes of cardio and weights. The one accomodation that I enjoyed the most was the swimming pool on the room. It was very nice. I loved swiming and looking at NOLA's modest skyline during my stay. I think that while we were there, the temperature was over 100 degrees every day. It was a wonderful relief coming in out of the swealtering heat into a cool environment. We loved the art We loved the refresing citrus water in the lobby We loved the location We loved the quiet We loved our room We loved our stay at the Renaissance Arts Hotel Thanks!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Great Service”
Reviews.Author: stevetanyaTexas
Reviews.Content: I've now stayed in this hotel 4 times. Every time meets or exceeds my expectations. What's even more impressive is when I provided feedback to the manager on how they could improve the executive lounge, he immediately followed up on my suggestions. Wow! Now that's customer service. The neighborhood is full of great restaurants all within walking distance. Bourbon street is just far enough away so you're not there... But close enough to walk. Great service and what-you-expect quality rooms from Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: mom2cutestboys
Reviews.Content: Not too excited to pay the amount we did for this hotel, although we booked on a weekend with a lot going on in town. The worst things is that we didn't know there was no parking for hotel guests (valet was a crazy amount I wasn't going to pay). The room was nothing special I could have paid half for a better sized room, with FREE continental breakfast. I will book farther in advanced next time to get more value and less money.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: capmap
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for only one night on our recent vacation to New Orleans. The hotel is in a nice, safe and quiet location in the city. It it beautiful and well appointed. The room was very clean and modern. The bathroom was also very clean and adequate in size for two people. The bed was very comfortable with the sheets being very soft and clean. I highly recommend this hotel and look forward to staying here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice artwork, close to cruise ship port”
Reviews.Author: frozencalbear
Reviews.Content: This hotel's location in a revitalized warehouse district filled with art shops and restaurants. You are one block away from Emeril Lagasse's restaurant and about a 20 minute walk to the French Quarter. The hotel is filled with its own modern and local artwork collection. Rooms are clean and well appointed. If your stay is pre or post cruise you could walk to the the cruise ship terminal. There is well equipped gym and a small pool on the roof. We had a pleasant stay and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, nice location”
Reviews.Author: Mal723
Reviews.Content: I stayed 12/26-12/28/2011, like the open feeling of the hotel, designed well, walking distance from French Quarter. La Cote Brasserie is an excellent restaurant, it's part of the hotel. Clean, comfortable, nice service, refreshing lobby-well thought out design that is open, airy, colorful, relaxing, and inviting. Excellent first rate health club facilities, rooftop pool w/ great views of the city. Club level rooms are best, also try and get access to the Club Level Lounge, which means full breakfast, beverages, snacks, business facilities, all in a comfortable, well appointed community room/relaxed lounge type setting with couches, nice tables, flat screen television, coffee table w/ magazines, newspapers, etc. Only thing which keeps me from giving it five stars is the fact there is not free wi-fi in the rooms-a bit disappointing; my understanding is there is wi-fi in the lobby-also there is a business center downstairs, and a computer where you can print your airline boarding pass if needed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CNM14
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on New Year's Eve and it was a great experience. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was slightly small but comfortable. There were too full beds instead of queen size. This hotel is about 10- 15 minute walk to the beginning of the French Quarter and the Riverwalk. This hotel is close of enough to the action but not too close to where the noise will keep you awake. Across the street, is a restaurant/bar that was hoping until later into night. The parking is valet and is about $37 a day.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite hotels in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Allen T
Reviews.Content: Went with a group of my friends and my girlfriend. We had 3 rooms. It was a perfect hotel. Beds were very comfortable. Very clean, and beautiful hotel. Location was just out of the french quarter, so quiet but very close to everything. Staff was professional and friendly. And it is just a short walk from the french quarter and convention center. The pool was very nice, on the roof. Nice fitness room.

Reviews.Title: “Sugar Bowl Visit”
Reviews.Author: JMJ_Flight
Reviews.Content: I travel to New Orleans 3-4 times a year.. I have never stayed at this property but will probably never stay anywhere else. Best Marriott property in New Orleans.... Rooms comparable to Harrah's rooms.. we love it there too! Huge Positives: - Gym is super! Up on top floor lots of new equipment and square footage. Pool and hot tub out doors are cool view.. - Hotel and rooms were very clean ! - Staff was very friendly and helpful! Early checkin for 3 rooms was easy - thanks! - Nice Conceirge lounge accessable to Marriott Members I believe! just ask... - Two blocks from Harrah's and waterfront.. GREAT LOCATION.. Thanks staff! See you next trip..

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in the Heart of New Orleans, LA”
Reviews.Author: BootsPlus4NVa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is truly a gem located in the heart of New Orleans. It's located within a moderate walk away from all of the action (Bourbon Street). It's also not too far from Audobon Aquarium of the Americas which is absolutely amazing. If you're looking for a great breakfast nearby checkout The Rubby Slipper Cafe (very affordable)! My only CON with the Renaissance is that our bed wasn't as comfortable as I would have liked.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great bed, great price”
Reviews.Author: renisans
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed three nights at this hotel and were very pleased with the value it offered, compared to pricier options around the area. It was close by to everything we wanted to see - the French Quarter, the Garden District, etc. The bed was especially cozy - form-fitting sheets and a firm mattress that was not lumpy like other places. The fitness center was nice and the jacuzzi was also very pleasant. Staff was very helpful and the common areas in the lobby and second floor featured interesting artwork from local artists. We would definitely stay here again upon returning to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Surprise in the Warehouse District!”
Reviews.Author: JLynne52
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed here one night before leaving on a cruise. It is on Tchoupitoulas in the Central Business District very close to the Port of New Orleans for easy cruise access. Beautiful hotel with VERY reasonable rates - less the $100 per night for 2 people. The lobby has three Chiluly glass chandeliers that are GORGEOUS! Rooms are large, comfortable and clean. Lots of restaurants in the area including Emeril's Restaurant is one block down. Also easy access to French Quarter, Superdome, Riverwalk etc. Hotel has a bar and an excllent restaurant as well. Would definitely go there again! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: 7RED_29
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nicely decorated but was a little disappointed regarding the room amenities. I know this is a boutique hotel but it would have helped to have a microwave and free wifi in the room, especially since some nearby establishments offer free wifi that you could connect to from your room. When I arrived I discovered that the hotel had experienced a water pipe burst Sunday so all the floors on one side of the hotel were flooded and had machines running to dry the water before they could start repairing the damages. Well that's all understandable but they put me right next to all the noise and where the incident took place... I phoned the receptionist and requested that I be removed from this area and they did. The valet service was great! This hotel is 1 minute from I-10! Overall I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, beautiful facility.”
Reviews.Author: SteveDELIWEAR
Reviews.Content: Clean, quiet and in a decent neighborhood. A hike to French Quarter but plenty of good restaurants within an easy walk, as well as galleries and the WWII Museum. Very expensive parking.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous rooms”
Reviews.Author: Peggy_Washington
Reviews.Content: Renaissance Arts Hotel in New Orleans is a wonderful place to stay. Comfortable beds and pillows, great staff, large rooms in an excellent location. My one complaint is you have to pay extra for wi-fi and if you don't know that ahead of time, you can be placed in a room that doesn't offer it. Then you have to shlep down to the business center if you need to go online. No hotel should be charging for wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Happy in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: legalbeag
Reviews.Content: The Rennaisance Hotel is in the middle of the arts District. Walking distance to Bourbon Street, Harrahs Casino and WWII museum. Great service and beautiful rooms

Reviews.Title: “Good option in a quiet area”
Reviews.Author: drpipt
Reviews.Content: This hotel is pretty nice. The layout is a bit odd -- if you have an interior room, your window will face the inside of the hotel. The property has been tastefully converted from a factory. The area is safe and well lit. It's only a few blocks away from the French Quarter, easily walkable. I enjoyed the various pieces of art. I did not try the restaurant, so I cannot really speak to that, but otherwise, it's a nice property, and a good option amongst your major hotel chains in NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: melibean
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Arts Hotel is located in the warehouse district, which is about a 15 minute walk from the French Quarter. The location is ideal because you are close to all the action but still in a quieter neighborhood. The hotel has a swanky feel in the lobby, and the rooms are about what I would expect from a Renaissance. My biggest complaint about the rooms is that whatever was on the other side of the wall from the bed would cause the headboard to vibrate, which bothered us when we were trying to sleep. As a Marriott Gold member, we had access to the lounge for breakfast and evening snacks during the week. There was a pretty good spread for both, and we could probably had made a dinner out of the food in the evening (soup, salad, chicken, etc.) Unfortunately, the lounge is closed on the weekends and this property doesn't provide breakfast vouchers.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Clean rooms, Artsy Decor, but”
Reviews.Author: vpj420
Reviews.Content: First off, I was in New Orleans on business and had never visited the city. This hotel was chosen for me because the V.P. of my company was staying there making logistics easy. We attended a seminar at the Hilton. My first impressions were that this is a very artsy type hotel located in the warehouse district of New Orleans. Upon check-in, the hotel looked very clean and they allowed me to check-in early even though I requested to check-in at 3 p.m. I entered the room and saw that is was very clean. The only negative thing I can say about the room is that there were some stains on the carpet near the door. Other than that, the room looked good. Those wishing to visit Harrah's Casino, the Hilton for conventions, or just on a trip will really appreciate the proximity. Emeril's restaurant is right around the corner, as is a number of restaurants and pubs. I was worried how the area would be at night, but rest assured that there is plenty of lighting in the area and never once did I feel in danger. My room was quiet and I had a pleasant nights sleep on the comfortable bed. The only downsides to this hotel are that it doesn't offer Wi-Fi or a continental breakfast. It does offer internet connections for a price. The breakfast matter shouldn't be a big deal since travelers will probably opt to try the numerous eateries like the famous Cafe Du Monde (which isn't very far away). Overall a great stay in a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel choice away from the chaos of the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: zhenevieve
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice 3-night stay at the Renaissance Arts Hotel, picked for us using Name Your Own Price on Priceline. We had an excellent deal on the place, which made a good hotel even better. The hotel's lobby, bar, and restaurant are all very impressive. Modern, arty, chic, and clean. While we didn't eat in the restaurant ever, it wasn't empty, which says something for a hotel with lots of other good places to eat around it. The room itself was great. Though square-footage wise, it was slightly on the small side (our king-bed room didn't leave a lot of extra floor space), the bed made up for anything else the room was lacking. At a glance, I thought it was going to be disappointing, as the mattress looked thin. But it was one of the most comfortable night's sleep I've had at a hotel in years. The mattress was phenomenal, the pillows soft, and the sheets velvety. It was hard to check out from. Also of note in the room was a mini-fridge. The bathroom was clean, and the shower quite excellent. Located in the Warehouse Arts District, we were surrounded by quality restaurants and lots of bars. Other standard places were a bit farther (it was a solid 15 - 20 minute walk to the closest drug store or grocery story). The French Quarter is walking distance, albeit a long walk, and though we never took a cab to and from the front desk staff said cabs from there to the hotel run roughly $7. We actually preferred being somewhat removed from the madness, and appreciated being in a quieter area. The only issue we had with the hotel was the parking: $31 a day for valet is your only option. We quickly figured out a trick to beat the system though. Street parking around the hotel is plentiful, and free from 6pm - 8am. New Orleans has a "pay by phone" parking system, so you just set up your phone account the night before, then get the info of the meter where you parked, set your alarm for 8am, wake up, make a 30 second call, and go back to sleep. For $3, you have two hours of parking. Repeat at 10am as needed, or actually head out with your car. Over the course of three nights and four days there, we didn't even spend close to $31 total. Had we gone with valet, it would have been over $100 for parking alone. It's sort of a pain in the butt to wake up every morning (even for two minutes) at 8am, but for us it was worth it to save the money. The hotel staff were fine, some nicer and more helpful than others, and definitely not the standout feature of the hotel. A few staff members were friendly and welcoming, others seemed mildly annoyed to be bothered with questions or problems. It wasn't a huge issue, but it wasn't the best service I've ever had at a hotel. (Again though, the bed was so comfortable that it made up for it.) This was a very good hotel. I don't know that I'd rate it as four-star, upscale, or luxury (the way Priceline does), but it was a very nice stay indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great deal”
Reviews.Author: Rockinjla
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for our annual college girls weekend. Booked 3 rooms using a AAA discount where we got breakfast for 2 included in our room rate. Hotel is located in nice, quieter neighborhood, across the street from a fun bar called Lucy's and on the same street as a good restaurant called Tommy's. Super easy to walk to French Quarter, convention center, and Harrah's. The hotel was clean, decorated in a neat, funky artsy way. Some rooms faced an atrium and seemed larger than the rooms that faced outside. So be forewarned that if you want to have a window looking outside, make sure you ask. The bar / restaurant area was very nice and the breakfast we had each morning there was very good, and the staff attentive. Only semi negative comments... every time I went to the front desk, there was no one there. They would eventually come around, and I never had to wait long. It was just a little odd. Same with the bell stand. And if you need a cab for the airport or a very specific time, you might want to call ahead and order one. A few of my friends had to wait awhile for a cab to appear to get to the airport and I ended up "hitching" a cab fare with some random people from another hotel on their way to the airport due to lack of cabs. Would HIGHLY recommend staying here for work or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for business or leisure”
Reviews.Author: eshattuck
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a long weekend in NOLA having not been back to the city for many years. We chose this hotel because of its spacious rooms and its close proximity to the places we wanted to visit (the WWII Museum, Ogden Museum, etc) and far enough away from the noise and crowds of Bourbon Street. Thanks to the LSU/BAMA game, even the warehouse district was crowded but not overwhelmingly so...after all, it is New Orleans and if its not crowded, that's not a good sign. We had a great time, enjoyed the comfort and cleanliness of the hotel and found everyone there to be pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fun in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Maineiac114
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights, everything was perfect. Nice area to walk around, felt safe enough. People were friendly and helpful. I would stay there again. Spend the money on the WWII museum and film, very well done.

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: kcolorado
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the opening weekend of Prospect II the art biennial. I found the hotel very comfortable- good beds and linens and the room was well appointed. I had a rate that included breakfast and I loved the food; did the buffet one morning and ordered from the menu the next day. I am sorry we didn't plan to have dinner there. We had a snack before we left on Sunday and it was very good and the menu looked interesting. My only complaint is that the lobby was icy cold all the time. I appreciated the business center and like the location- close enough to good restaurants but not as crazy as the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Karlyforet
Reviews.Content: Hotel is fabolous!! 5 stars! Would stay there again for any price!!

Reviews.Title: “Buyer Beware!!”
Reviews.Author: Kyle_Polk
Reviews.Content: Let's start off on a positive note. This hotel is located in a decent location. The physical infrastructure is nice. Now the real feedbackâ€¦ This hotel has a Four star rating on most sites. Let me assure, beyond a shadow of a doubt. This hotel is not even a competitive Two star. I mean that. There are 40K hotels in New Orleans, don't make the mistake of picking this one. I would not recommend this place to my friend, co-worker or random online patron. I stayed here for a week and I experienced enough to know the difference between a 1-off problem and a systemic issue. 1. My room didnâ€™t have Wi-Fi. When I called to inquire, the front desk told me only certain rooms have Wi-Fi. I think most citizens of the 21st century would agree thatâ€™s the stupidest thing ever. But whatever, I asked how much I would have to pay to upgrade to a "Wi-Fi" room. The Response, " You paid on hotels.com so we can't do anything for you." What?!? Is that a joke? No it's real. In reality, the lady was insinuating that because I made my reservations on hotels.com I was a 2nd class customer and that my options for upgrades or switches were restricted. 2. One late night I went to the front desk to ask for a spoon for my yogurt. The Response, " go get one from the kitchen." Yea, the kitchen thatâ€™s pitch dark at 11pm--that one. The guy who said it resembles Braxton from the Jamie Fox Show so look out for him should you ever end up stranded at this DEAD END DESTINATION. To add insult to injury, I got back to my room only to find out my refrigerator was BROKEN. Not the obvious type of broken, but the kind where it looks like it's working but actually it's just staying luke-warm. Lost $50 worth of perishable goods. 3. My co-worker had the breakfast. Terrible. Two bites and pushed it away. 4. They missed my wake up call, twice!!! 5. But here is the best one: I was trying to use the printer in the computer room. Of course like everything else in this place- it wasn't working. So I went to the Front Desk. I liked the guy who worked the desk that night, so I won't throw him under the bus. But get this, I said to him can you fix the printer because myself and another hotel patron need to print something off for work. He said, I can't fix it man, but come into the back and use the back office printer. I said thanks, and replied should I grab the other guy who needs to print his work stuff. He replied: NO!! I'll be honest guys. New Orleans is such a great place that it's easy to forget that this is a service based economy. These hotels compete on SERVICE. The valet service was GREAT. The Concierge service was GREAT. But the real service that matters, Front Desk, Restaurant, etc. is the PITTS! My company pays for my room and food so I don't care about the MONEY, I care about the EXPERIENCE. I check out on Friday because it was SO BAD and move over to The W for my remaining 2 nights. The W was AH-MAZING! At the end of my stay I spoke with Patrick, the manager, and he was appalled. He is really nice and he tried to compensate me, but it was too lateâ€¦ Do yourself a favor: Take that same $100+ dollars you are going to spend here and walk two blocks and stay at The W, Loews, Sheraton, Harrah's, International House---for the same price!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: shannon50
Reviews.Content: Pros: Clean spacious rooms Mini Fridge in the room Friendly helpful staff Location was a bit off the beaten track which I liked Cons: Water pressure in shower wasn't very good Valet price was a bit expensive AC was pretty noisy Overall if I went back to NO I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice for a stay in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: adanacsim
Reviews.Content: For those who are interested in exploring NOLA, this warehouse district hotel is ideally situated -- about equidistant from the French Quarter, the Riverwalk and the museums area. The lobby is tasteful and spacious, with an impressive Chihuly chandelier (or else an impressive copy). The rooms are comfortable, though not plush. Breakfast at the adjacent restaurant, La Cote Brasserie, was plentiful and good (though not great). The hotel is a quiet oasis from the frenzy of the French Quarter; however, even though the rooms have double-paned windows, you can still hear some of the partyers on the street at night, so ask for a room on a higher floor to minimize the noise. This hotel was an excellent value for the price paid, and it would have rated more highly if some of the linens had not been torn and if the cold water faucet didn't run warm even after several minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in Warehouse District”
Reviews.Author: Moorea664
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in the Warehouse/ Arts District, about a 10 minute walk from the French Quarter Canal Street border. Lobby is very nicely done. Roome are adequate.- one of our two rooms was a bit musty- as though there had been a flood. Quiet. Pillows were too firm. Valet parking $31 /day.. a bit costly. Free Wi-Fi only in common areas. In room internet /wirelessavailable for $5-$12 /day. Didn't take it so I don't remember exactly which was which. There is a business center with internet access and a computer to use to print boarding passes. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just Great (Again!)”
Reviews.Author: Travlisforme
Reviews.Content: My 2nd time to the Renaissance Arts Hotel, and once again we were thrilled. The decor and design are beautiful, its spotless and in top shape, and the staff was wonderful! The area is beginning to come together, so yes, you have to either walk a few blocks or drive to the quarter, but since its not so congested, its easy to get in and out. The only small complaint I had is that the lobby was absolutely freezing from the A/C pouring down. Bravo! Great Place!

Reviews.Title: “Nice & Comfy”
Reviews.Author: madisonvillebabydoll
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with a group of ladies for our HS reunion that was held at a local place downtown.. Was very reasonable priced, rooms were nice & so was hotel... Do not recommend the breakfast bar in the morning.. cost $18.00 & was terrible.....

Reviews.Title: “An amazing experience. We will be back again and again!”
Reviews.Author: TumblingMom
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped out of our vehicle, and began dealing with Evans and the other wonderful valet/bellmen, we were treated like VIP customers. The front desk staff (especially Rose), the navigator, and the valets (especially Evans) were phenomenal. The staff greeted me by name at every encounter. Evans pointed out many restaurants and experiences that we wouldn't have tried otherwise. The valets are very knowledgable, and very generous with their time to make your experience enjoyable. The location of this hotel is ideal. Right in the heart of the Warehouse/Arts district, and yet 3 blocks from the convention center and Riverwalk, close to the French Quarter, near the streetcar stops and the ferry. You couldn't ask for anything more. Every merchant or staff person we dealt with in the Warehouse District was friendly. We felt safe, even walking with young girls after dark. There is art everywhere--inside the hotel, and all around the district--beautiful buildings, sculptures, paintings, etc. The highlight for us was the rooftop pool and hot tub. At night it was so wonderful to lie back in the pool, staring at the stars. The rooms were spacious and immaculately clean. The large flat-screen TV's were very nice, and I made constant use of the safe. The walls were insulated very well. We stayed while we were competing in the Junior Olympics and were right in the middle of the block of rooms for young athletes and their families. Over my 6-night stay, I heard a man sneeze outside my door one time. Other than that, I did not ever hear another guest. For days I thought we had no neighbors. The smell of the hotel is sweet and floral, and adds to the overall experience. We loved the fruited water in the lobby, and grabbed a glass every time we passed. We are already trying to figure out how quickly we can get back for another visit. This hotel exceeded my expectations in every way. Located 1/2 block from Emeril's, and across the street from Lucy's. Half Moon and Daisy Duke's deliver here until the early morning hours. Be sure to take advantage of all that's right there around you--including your staff!

Reviews.Title: “Interesting hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: GJM3
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights over St Joseph's weekend...the room was standard/typical but the public areas are very interesting. Lots of artfully decorated open spaces including a sculpture garden and a gallery space. Didn't swim in the rooftop pool, but had a look and it seemed nice. Location is good for most purposes. Less than 10 minutes' walk to Canal St and the start of the French Quarter - conveniently close, but far enough away to avoid the crowds and noise. We went to a Hornets (basketball) game at the arena and that was also only a 10-15 minute walk. The St Josephs parade in Central City was a quick trip via public transportation. The area immediately around the hotel also has some good attractions, including a clothing boutique across the street, an Australian-themed bar a few doors down, and "Lucy's" restaurant/bar also on Tchoupitoulas St.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and Central location”
Reviews.Author: rocketsfan007
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at the Renaissance (first review) and once again it did not disappoint! I lived in New Orleans for 7 years previsouly and return monthly to visit friends, but rarely stay in hotels. After a couple of times here, I have no reason to stay anywhere else. The service was impeccable, particularly for Nola, as any local knows. The concierge called me a couple of days before to confirm a few requests I made and greeted us on arrival. The bell man was extremely friendly and talkative as he brought our bags up and explained the layout of the hotel and what part of town we were in. Whenever we returned to the hotel we were always greeted with a smile and "Hello". I cannot say enough about the staff all around. The room and condition of the hotel were also both up to Marriott standards. The hotel as an artsy theme to it that fits in with the warehouse district which makes it unique from many hotels. The room was clean and comfortable with the standard amemities. My only complaint was that the walls must be thin, because we could occasionally hear the people next to us talking. I particularly like staying in the warehouse district. I think it provides a central location to get to both the Quarter and Uptown/Garden District. Both are about a $10 cab ride away. Lucy's, Vic's. amd Wino were some of my favorite bars when I lived here, so it is also nice to have them within a couple blocks. And Emeril's, Tommy's, and Cochon are also nearby. I have no doubts I would stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Cool, Cute Hotel”
Reviews.Author: iluvdatiger
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice and both times had a good experience. When you walk into the lobby of the hotel, you should immediately notice the fantastic smelling candles. It's a very spa-ish relaxing, rejuvenating smelling lobby thanks to those candles. I liked them so much I am buying them for my house! The hotel has lots of cool art and sculptures throughout the building. The rooms are a good size as well as the bathrooms. The location is good if you are planning to do things other than hang out in the quarter. It is surrounded by great restaurants within walking distance in the warehouse district. It is across the street from Lucy's Surfer Bar, which we really love. It's close to the WWII museum and there is a good little restaurant in there for the lunch crowd. Tommy's is a good restaurant for dinner near there. There is also a restaurant downstairs that we ate at for breakfast called La Cote Brasserie. I have heard dinner there is good. This hotel is also pretty close to Harrah's casino and the Riverwalk. I like staying here and will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Just all around AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: ahickman56
Reviews.Content: This hotel is gorgeous! I would definately recommend to anyone traveling to the city. My husband and I spent a night here for his birthday and it was very romantic. It is in walking distance to many nice restaurants, the riverwalk, and harrah's.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Good - Nearby Convention Center and French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: jdieringer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel due to a conference at the Convention Center. It is just a short walk and found this rate to be notably better than the Conference Hotel (Hilton). This modern hotel is quite well decorated, open air lobby and the rooms are particularly large. Very clean and well maintained (it looks to be only a few years old). The fitness center is fine and there is a pool and hot tub on the roof. Overall a surprisingly nice experience at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK.”
Reviews.Author: justrenren
Reviews.Content: We saw such a good rate online ($89), so we decided to make our way to New Orleans during our road trip. We did not look closely at all the details and were a little shocked with all the additional fees when we got there. I can't lower the rating for that because it was our own fault, but I would like to point it out so that others can be prepared. You are not allowed to park your own car. They will take your vehicle when you arrive, for a $28 charge, and park it in a place that you are not allowed to access. We had been to a few other downtown Marriott hotels previous to New Orleans and never encountered not being able to have access to our car. They stated that they would drive the car around if we needed it for anything, but that didn't really pan out the way they said. Another charge that we were not prepared for was the fee for having the Internet in your room. ($12.95 per night using the cable or more $$ using wireless) We opted not to pay for it. Most of the staff was very friendly, the art was interesting to look at around the hotel, and the place was very quiet. I don't think there were very many people staying there when we were there, which may explain the emptiness and quietness. The elevator had some kind of sticky goo on the rails and spilled liquid on the floor for hours which kinda grossed me out every time I used it. Overall, I was not as impressed with this Marriott as I've been with all the others I've stayed at, but it wasn't terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value - good all-around”
Reviews.Author: stefmo
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a business-related trip in July - just four blocks away from the New Orleans Convention Center, about a half-mile from Canal Street, and (most important!!!!) about a mile from Cafe DuMonde. Strikingly decorated with two atria (either side of the elevators), clean and relaxing. Great free breakfast, included with a room rate of $135. Public areas are all amazingly clean and well-kept; beautiful music piped in. My room on the 3rd floor overlooked Tchoupitoulas Street. Even with all the late-night activity on the street, my room was quiet. The bed and linens were top-shelf and I slept like a rock! The room itself was good-sized and well appointed. The bathroom was a bit on the small side, but still adequate. A couple of minor things to point out: the water in the shower fluctuated from tepid to scalding; the shower curtain was almost too short to direct the water into the tub, and the carpet was fairly worn in the traffic areas. The closet door is on an auto-close hinge, making it difficult to choose an outfit! :) However, the room was very clean and the furnishings were great. Still - back to that old Marriott policy of charging for in-room Internet... Makes me crazy to have to pay for it! Free Wi-Fi in the comfortable lobby, where there is fresh citrus water for the taking. Concierge & front desk staff were courteous and helpful. Bellhops remembered us from check-in, saying "welcome back" after we'd wandered down to the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “We really liked it!!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler46756
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great and the people working there are very kind too. It is very clean and it looks quite new also. We stayed for four nights. I gave the hotel four stars as the location (although it is good) is not excellent as the walk to the french quarter is a bit long and at night its not so convenient to be so far away from the restaurants and bars.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Nine0Nine
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to New Orleans. Stayed here over the Memorial Day holiday. Hotel was in a great location. Walked everywhere, Harrahs, French Qtr, etc. Hotel was very clean and a welcome site after spending the entire day exploring the city. Our room was spacious and I would definately stay here again. We stumbled back to the hotel at 3AM and felt just as safe as 3 in the afternoon. We did not explore the pool area or use valet service but service was very friendly at front desk. Always greeted as we arrived. Clean, quite, convienent location.

Reviews.Title: “Warehouse District Location is Great!!”
Reviews.Author: loverofdogs
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 visited New Orleans for a wedding and I didn't want to stay in a high rise hotel or any where near Royal or Bourbon Streets with 2 young children. I found this hotel to be charming and in a great area. It was very quiet and still walking distance to everything you would want to see in the city!

Reviews.Title: “here for business would come back for pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: islandgirlcityboy
Reviews.Content: I am amazed at the negative reviews below! My experience is, almost without exception, a good one. Simple, but important, first impressions.....like the fresh smell, calming music and art installations..... give the idea that this is an oasis from the hottest, muggiest of days. My room is comfortable and quiet (although I am glad I am in an interior room and not on the street) and perfectly serviced by the cleaning team. The WIFI is fast, reliable and included in the room rate, the business centre means you can print essential documents and the reception personnel are very helpful. My only gripe, if I had to find one, is the shower - it is either hot or cold and no amount of fine tuning gets it right! However, I didn't bother to report it so I can't blame the hotel. I plan to come back to N.O. on vacation and would definitely stay here if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: Bear729
Reviews.Content: After booking through Travelocity, separately had to call the hotel directly to specify our preference for a king bed in a quiet part of the hotel (which would be the higher floors not on Tchoupitoulas Street in a room which does not have an adjoining door). Hotel was great in many respects. We only have minor gripes which are: (1) only able to book a "king or double" and while I was able to specify our preference for a king, we 'rolled the dice' in whether or not we would actually get a king. We did get a king upon arrival so all was fine. (2) Housekeeping was a little slow to restock soap / tissues. Front desk was super quick in getting us soap / tissues when we requested. (3) Bathroom standing area is a bit small (4) Rooftop pool area could use a little more decor (5) Concierge had recommended a nearby club for live cajun music and dancing on the corner of Julia and Convention Center Blvd. She didn't mention how early they might close on a Friday night (11am) (6) We could hear the adjacent room's door slamming shut on occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good value”
Reviews.Author: hester52
Reviews.Content: The room size was fine - mine looked out onto the quirky sculpture garden, which was a plus. Bed was great, service was friendly. Bathroom was ok, and I didn't experience the water temperature or pressure problems described by other travelers. However, a magnifying mirror would have been welcome. On the minus side, at the price they're charging, general upgrading is needed. There's no wireless internet, and the ethernet cable is short, so you can't use your computer while sitting on the bed. For this privilege, you pay $12.95 a night. Analog TV. A/C in the lobby and restaurant was turned up so high (and it was not hot outside) that it was uncomfortable to sit in the restaurant. Service there was friendly but extremely slow. At breakfast, there were at most three tables occupied, and it took several inquiries before a hostess appeared. No seating area in the lobby. Printer in the business center didn't work. The desk clerk offered to print my boarding pass, but this took about 10 minutes and involved his going back and forth from the desk to another room and apparently several printers. Not efficient. The hotel is ok, but not at the prices they're charging.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: JC1064
Reviews.Content: I first stayed here just after it opened and it was lovely. Now however the rooms are OK - standard fare, the wireless internet does not work so you have to use wired (however youc an connect fro a charge to the Embassy Suites wireless for a fee which works greeat!) The standard of food is poor - I had room service on 2 occasions - the first time the shrimp were not properly cleaned and still had the black lines down the back, the second time the cheese plate came up without any of the extras specified on the menu - it was not eve worthy of a wallmart cheeseplate. The food in the concierge lounge is no better. You can hear everything going on in the rooms next door.I have stayed in other hotels in NO before and would not stay here again. There are plenty of other hotels nearby to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for WW2 museum and galleries”
Reviews.Author: londoncal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Renaissance Arts Hotel for the first time and found it perfectly adequate - but we agree we would stay elsewhere on our next visit. The location is terrific for the WW2 museum and within a pleasant 15- 20 minute walk to the heart of the French Quarter. The lobby area is beautiful, but there is insufficient seating if the public areas are being used as break/reception areas for conventions/meetings at the hotel while your room is being cleaned. Rooms were spacious and well appointed but the bathroom had no fan and poor water pressure. Maid service was high quality; concierge, bellhop and desk service was of very good quality but thin.

Reviews.Title: “Great location if meeting at the convention center”
Reviews.Author: zithelp
Reviews.Content: We arrived late and upgraded to a suite and since we were staying 6 nights it was worth it. We used the concierge lounge often for breakfast, snacks and even some dinners as we usually at a big lunch uptown. The room was well appointed but the carpet a bit worn. Our room was quite and the bed comfortable. The decor was "art-deco" so not overly plush but comfortable. We had no issues during the stay and the maid always did a great job cleaning up. My wife used the exercise room daily and said it was good. Several good restaurants nearby. We walked everywhere and felt it was well located to the French Quarter and the Convention Center. It was too cold during our stay in early February to enjoy the rooftop deck and pool but what a view! We did get up there our last night to enjoy "happy hour" all bundled up. We would stay here again, even if not going to the convention center.

Reviews.Title: “Expect to repeat yourself, but eventually they will get it done”
Reviews.Author: Juli Z
Reviews.Content: In all respects a very pleasant place to stay, in a great location, away from the noise and tourist mess of the French Quarter. Housed in a solid old warehouse building, the Renaissance boasts large windows (which unfortunately do not open) a wonder-ful indoor art garden courtyard and rooftop pool and hot tub. Some rooms are larger than others, the corners are of the most ample with decent decor and analogue televisions (which I happen to prefer over flat screens). The bathtubs are too small to soak, so a roomy stand up shower would have been a better fit. Aveda toiletries were a welcome little bonus. If you were to stay here a day or two, I imagine your stay would be smooth sailing. If like me however you spend a few weeks at the hotel (quite likely any hotel) you'll begin to notice where it falls short. The main issue is the lack of effective communication among the staff. Although most of the them are friendly, they do not function as a team. And so when you call the front desk with a request, if the person on the other line cannot take care of it immediately, themselves, which often they cannot, the message is quickly lost in the telephone chain. Here's an example: Hello, my tea mug (from home) has gone missing since the room was cleaned this afternoon, can I speak to housekeeping? No, I cannot connect you directly. I will call them to inquire and get back to you. Next day, no call back. So I call again. And the next day go down to the front desk and remind them. On day three someone from reception calls me say that housekeeping knows nothing about it... Really? That's the best you can do? And if my laptop had gone missing? Complete lack of accountability. The next week I ask the front desk, on three separate occasions if they have packages for me that should have been delivered. No they don't. After a week of asking I finally insisted that they went to speak to the guard who had signed for them. I had his name from the tracking info. Oh, what do you know, they do have them... Obviously communication is a problem here. A hotel probably has at least three shifts of staff on a daily basis, how they relay information to one another is crucial in making sure things run smoothly. And like I said, you probably won't notice if you're here for a quickie.

Reviews.Title: “An average stay in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: lhinesabc
Reviews.Content: I would rate this hotel average to below average. The rooms are relatively spacious and feature a comfortable king bed, desk and chair. The bathrooms are really very plain. There is no flat screen tv and cable channels are extremely limited. Rooms also feature a safe and fridge. Housekeeping was efficient. The carpets were worn and could be refreshed. The hotel has a pleasant brasserie on the ground floor serving local specialties. There is also a large bar area. I did not notice a business center, but there is a computer available for printing airline boarding passes. The hotel charges for wifi access in the rooms. There are a few glaring deficiencies. First, the hotel has a serious issue with the supply of hot water. On one morning, it was tepid at best and our entire group of friends complained about it. Not a good way to start the day. In addition, some members of our group had issues with water pressure. In one case, they barely had a trickle of water in the shower. This is an issue that most guests are unwilling to tolerate. Room service also left items off the order. The hotel provides free coffee in the lobby but all four pots were empty and it took over 30 minutes for them to be filled after we pointed out the problem. In short, I would only stay here if I had to be in New Orleans and I couldn't get a reservation in a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, near the conference center and close to the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: RHC4
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel as I was attending a large professional convention at the Ernest Morial Convention Center. The hotel was only a 10 minute walk to the convention center with good sidewalks and crosswalks. There are trolley cars that run along the Mississippi River that easily transport you from the convention center to the French Quarter. From the trolley stop it is just a short walk to Bourbon Street. You can also walk from the hotel to the French Quarter in about 20-30 minutes. Cabs are also a way to travel (they can get pricey). The front desk assistance at check-in was poor, which resulted in me downgrading the service rating for this hotel. I did not find the bed extremely comfortable (it was OK) and I stay in several hotels a month, If you can get this hotel at a reasonable price, it is a good value. This is a very clean hotel, located away from the noise of the French Quarter but close enough to get to without much effort. The hotel staff is usually very friendly, although they need to work on their efficiency during the check-in process and to understand that the check-in experience sets the first (and sometimes the lasting) impression of every hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Renaissance site”
Reviews.Author: bluffvilla
Reviews.Content: This is a handy location for walking to convention center or WWII museum. French Quarter is about a 15 minute walk. Emeril's restaurant is in the next block - 3 minute walk. The hotel has Chihuly works in the lobby and other interesting sculptures and plantings throughout the common areas. Restaurant and bar in the hotel are first class. The staff was friendly, and the concierge lounge was well stocked and serviced. Rooms are modern, with safes and fridges. Very clean overall.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, lousy internet”
Reviews.Author: CulinarySnob
Reviews.Content: Spent a long weekend i n early Feb 2011. First the positives: Upscale decor and rooms, people side of the service was excellent. For example, I wanted to know if a local bar had wireless. The desk clerk coudn't reach them on the phone so he ran over to check personally, then called me back (more later on why he even needed to check on wireless somewhere else). Our hot water was sporadic. The hotel engineer showed up within minutes and changed out the hot water mixing valve. We were given a $40 voucher for the restaurant that night. Fitness center above average, but as is typical, poorly maintained equipment. No mirrors on the walls, a big miss for anyone slightly knowledgable about gym design. Nice roof top pool + hot tub. Now for the negative - INTERNET ACCESS STINKS!! First of all they charged me $12 or so for access. This is like biling for the electricity used during the stay, and marking it up 3000%. Then, it barely functions. I gave up on the wireless part and used the ethernet cable in the room, no difference in speed. I even ran a speed test on-line, came in at less than 10% of an average ISP connection. I couldn't bear the 1minute or so between web clicks so I gave up. Called the front desk, they said they were aware of speed issues and took the charge off my bill. The clerk volunteered their business center computer. I did use it to print out my boarding pass, same slow speed, took over 15 min to print it, and only allowed access to airline websites. This place needs a serious upgrade in internet service and to get with the times - stop charging for it.

Reviews.Title: “What New Orleans is all about - awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Allboys03
Reviews.Content: As veterans of Jazz Fest, I had always wanted to stay at the Ren Arts Hotel and a recent business trip offered me just that chance. This is truly a gem in the Warehouse District. From the remarkable fresh smells when you walk in, to the unbelievable art work, it is just the place to stay in New Orleans, especially for business. I strongly encourage you to stay here if you are at the convention center or instead of the W and Hilton. It has just the perfect combination of atmosphere and New Orleans enthusiasm. We had a small faculty party in the bar, and Desi was amazing. He set up a great New Orleans happy hour and to top it off a Mardi Gras parade went right by the front door. Don't keep clicking...just stay here!

Reviews.Title: “really nice hotel in the CBD/Warehouse district”
Reviews.Author: dajmmdcc
Reviews.Content: we spent several nights here in january 2011 and highlights included the rooftop jacuzzi and fantastic front desk staff. the location is in the central business / warehouse district and while it's walkable to the french quarter, definitely plan on taking cabs if you don't have a car. the riverfront streetcar is located a few block away and there are quite a few good restaurants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; very accommodating staff.”
Reviews.Author: Evan06
Reviews.Content: My parents and I linked up in New Orleans for a quick weekend after I had business in the area and we had a great stay at this hotel. The staff, especially the porters, bell staff, valet parking attendants, and front desk staff were especially accommodating and polite toward my parents. The hotel's location in the up-and-coming Warehouse/Arts district was nice on it's own - some nice galleries in the area, a good restaurant in the hotel and others in the neighborhood, etc. In addition, it was close enough to enjoy the tourist spots of New Orleans such as the World War II museum, the street car to the Garden District and the French Quarter. The art work in the hotel itself was fun to look at and made the hotel generally and more interesting than average. I really liked the workout / exercise room - lots of good, well-maintained, and clean equipment - with drinking water and towels available - along with personal TVs and headphones available for the aerobic (treadmill, cycle, etc.) stations. Overall, it was a great stay and we look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, great location, comfortable, quiet, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: willowny
Reviews.Content: We are repeat visitors to New Orleans and like to stay at different hotels in slightly different locations each time. We definitely plan on returning to the Renaissance Arts Hotel. The location is very good, in the CBD, just a bit outside the French Quarter. We were outside the craziness, but close enough to walk to the River, Quarter, and Casino. We also were able to investigate the CBD more, and go to some different restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. The hotel was very clean, with an attractive lobby. The staff were all extremely friendly and helpful, even before our arrival. We were upgraded to the Club level, and given a bottle of sparkling wine and strawberries for our anniversary, with a nice note. It also made available to us the Club lounge for snacks in the morning and evening. The room was nice, clean, and spacious. It was cleaned quickly every day, regardless of when we left and returned. We like to have a balcony to enjoy being outside while in NO, which we didn't have here, but we went up on the roof by the pool and lounged in the chairs in the sun. It was lovely. The hotel was very quiet. We only heard anyone once or twice when there were particularly loud people walking down the hall. Other than that, there was no noise at all, and we felt very secluded in our room. There was even a wedding on Saturday night, with no noise traveling upstairs at all. We highly recommend the Renaissance Arts Hotel, and definitely will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “New Year's Eve”
Reviews.Author: JotaJota56
Reviews.Content: Very nice Hotel and Area, except that it is a fair walk from French Quarter. Very good Restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELLINGRICHARDS
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stay here when we can't get a good price at the JW Marriot. It is trendy, colorful, and vibrant. We don't really have any complaints - the rooms were nice and clean, the hotel seemed pretty quiet, the front desk staff was helpful, and the overall ambiance is just laid back. It's further away from the night life in the french quarter than we like, but it's still walking distance.Our stay was neither outstanding nor abysmall, just average.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: tammikins2000
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel housed in a converted warehouse. Those who love and appreciate the arts will love this place as will anyone who appreciates wonderful, helpful and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good, with a couple of minuses”
Reviews.Author: RadioDave23
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Room 337, mid-Nov. 2010. PROS: Great air/hotel deal via Priceline. Nice lobby and very appealing hallways with (seemingly) new carpeting. Friendly front deskers. When the area had a sewer-water problem, we were provided with lots of bottled water (guests at the nearby Hilton Riverfront apparently weren't given anything). Nice bathroom w/ good shower. Fridge in the room! Not loaded with mini-bar crap, just a great space to keep snacks and a beverage or two (there's a Walgreens on Canal St.). Not a lot of cable channels, but the TV set is good, and HBO is included. My wife loved our (painted) exposed brick wall w/ windows facing the street, which gives the room a touch of a Greenwich Village-apartment feel. CONS: Room carpet is downright worn and shabby and really deteriorates from the overall room. I peeked into some other rooms nearby when maids were cleaning, and their carpets were the same, Just changing the carpets would raise the room from a "B" to an "A-". One of the room's lampshades also had seen seriously better days. Lobby has piped in perfumed air, which is not my thing and probably more bothersome to people with allergies. They charge $13 a night for WiFi (includes free local & long distance phone), and there are no free computers to use in the lobby, so prepare to be gouged or go elsewhere for the `net. In this day and age and in a hotel like this, WiFi should be part of the package. There are free USA Today's in the lobby, but no free newspaper at your room door. There's an odd blue sculpture on the bathroom wall - nothing wrong with that, but it collects a lot of dust in its nooks and crannies that is never properly cleaned. Kinda gross. OTHER: Excellent mattress but very soft (feather?) pillows. When I asked for foam pillows to be brought up, two more pillows were delivered - but they were feather, also. When we first checked in, we asked for a quiet room. The desk attendant suggested a room on the second floor looking into the "garden" (which is inside the hotel). Turns out the garden is just a couple of plants, and near them is a rotating metal sculpture with spotlights around it. This flickering monstrosity would have been right outside our window, so we changed rooms immediately! There's a noisy tavern, Lucy's, on the other side of the street on Tchoupitoulas, but the rooms are very quiet, so you literally won't notice it until you're outside. Also, Tchoup is far enough away from Bourbon Street to be an overall quieter neighborhood. There's a gym, an outdoor pool and hot tub, but I didn't get a chance to use `em. OVERALL: Quite satisfied with the stay, but wouldn't necessarily run back. They need to change the carpets immediately and stop gouging for WiFi.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular place in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: flymeaway89
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel were very nice and accomodating. Our room was spacious. We had 4 people staying in the same room and there was plenty of room for all of our luggage and things. The bathroom was a little small and didn't have a fan so it got really hot when showering. There is a nice roof top area with tables to hang out and a small but cozy pool and hot tub. We did not use the pool but did hang out on the roof top a little. The hotel is in a great location. It's only about 4 blocks from the River Walk and a street car stop. The hotel is in walking distance to Bourbon Street- probably about 7 blocks. Within about 3-4 blocks of the casino, Canal Street, and many great bars/restaurants. Jackson Square was a little farther to walk but we did walk there too. The staff were very helpful when we asked for directions or a good place to eat/drink. There was also a business center there which made it very easy to look up things to do and check email. There is a place called Lucy's across the street that was great for food and drinks. We did not take advantage of the rest./bar at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy and Colorful”
Reviews.Author: Luiz44
Reviews.Content: An amazing space full of contemporary chef dâ€™oeuvres, in a very good location and a lot of arts galleries nearby. Conveniently located if you are going to the convention center or the French quarter. Good standard rooms with all amenities you expect from a 4 stars hotel

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for a visit to New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Pomonan
Reviews.Content: We could not have been happier with our choice, based mainly on TripAdvisor reviews, of this hotel for our first visit to New Orleans. The warehouse district is interesting and felt safe to walk around, and we were happy to be away from - though in reach of - the French quarter. The hotel itself is very nicely presented, with original artwork throughout, and service was friendly. We found it the ideal place both to sleep and rest between meals - this city is incredible for the choice and quality of food. Rooms were clean and comfortable; old CRT TVs need updating but Aeron chairs are a welcome surprise. The rooftop pool is indeed small, but it's nice to have an outdoor space. As I said before, this was our first visit to New Orleans. I hope there are more to come, and if so this hotel would definitely be part of our plans.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite hotels.”
Reviews.Author: travel7continents
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Renaissance Arts in New Orleans 5 or 6 times and have enjoyed our stays each time.The hotel is decorated with original art and is beautiful. It is not the cookie cutter chain hotel. Each time we stay there, I take photos of whatever new art is in the hotel. We like the neighborhood and find it a nice area to walk and look into the art galleries and restaurants in the area. The staff is willing to help, but I can not remember ever having to ask them for any service.I consider that a sign of good management and a efficient staff. I highly recommend the LaCote Brasserie which is in a corner of the lobby. The food is as good as many more well known restaurants in New Orleans. It has been my favorite for dinner when my husband is out for meetings. Even when the hotel is full of guests, the hotel tends to be quiet and restful. The rooms are very comfortable. We have stayed in other hotels in the Warehouse and CBD, but this remains our favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Great convention center hotel”
Reviews.Author: renicksc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights for a conference at the convention center which was a short walk away. Location is great. The Quarter is a close walk, but the area around the hotel was a little cleaner and nicer than the Canal/Bourbon St hotels. Good restaurants nearby (went to Mulattes & Bouche, both were good local spots) Rooms were immaculate and I had no issues with noise as I read in other posts. Other room doors nearby closing can be heard at times (no worse than most hotels), but definitely not "paper thin" walls. My only complaint was a touchy hot/cold shower knob that was either cold or scorching. The staff was helpful & attentive at every turn. I would definitely go back to the Renaissance Arts the next time I'm in NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “Better than we could have imagined”
Reviews.Author: jarakus
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the pleasure of staying here for three days, and it's been a while since we enjoyed a hotel this much! Outstanding location in the Warehouse District, which I now realize is much better than staying in the French Quarter....less noise, rowdiness, and crowds, and more value, character and options than almost any other place we saw. It's two or three blocks to Harrah's Casino (better than we thought), Riverwalk (ditto), the World War II museum (awesome and powerful), and the streetcar lines, and a short walk to the French Quarter and all it has to offer. The hotel is a wonderful blend of converted warehouse, artsy cosmopolitan, peaceful retreat, and sophisticated funky, without the guesswork of getting a good boutique hotel.....just wonderful. The beds are great, rooms are spacious (though baths could be larger), furnishings are new, everything (public areas also) is spotless, employees courteous and plentiful. There is a genuine New orleans bar (Lucy's) directly across the street (which hops at night), and a genuine dive bar two doors down. Also, unlike many of the boutique hotels in town, it is comfortable....not pretentious. Absolutely elated, and we have high standards (Marriott Gold, Hilton Silver, etc.). I would never consider another place if in town again
