Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient base for seeing New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: PF2UK
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty good hotel. The interior design is a bit garish - it's not as sophisticated-looking as the name suggested - a bit late-80s I suppose and lots of bright colours. But the rooms are good and the location is good too. The first night we were badly disturbed by other guests partying in the middle of the night. Most of the rooms connect to a room next door and the people through our connecting door didn't want to sleep. But guests were also running up and down the corridors shouting and banging on doors. Maybe this is how it is in hotels in New Orleans on a Saturday night - it is a party town after all - but it's not what I needed after travelling for about 16 hours from the UK. We also had 'internal windows' in that our room looked out onto an atrium not the outside. Which was bit gloomy. Reception staff were very helpful though the next morning and moved us to a larger corner room on the floor above. This was great - spacious and full of light from the outside. And no more noise problems. So the rest of the stay was really good. Only other complaint would be the parking - pretty expensive although the valet staff are quick and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “It is lame to pay for things which are free at motels.”
Reviews.Author: mars2025
Reviews.Content: NOT FREE: wifi, parking, breakfast NO Laundry in building. Pathetic fitness room. Some rooms lack a refrigerator. You have to walk three blocks to another Marriott if you want to do laundry. There is a small pool on the roof. The common areas are nice. There is a lounge upstairs if you can negotiate access to it as my company has. The same goes for the negotiating a free breakfast, but if you do negotiate breakfast you'll have to tell the staff when you are checking out--EVERY time you check out; they know the breakfast ins included in the bill but they will charge you for it if you don't tell them to cut it out. The staff are a nuisance, they tend to get underfoot to a certain extent. The location is good--the French Quarter is nearby. (I have stayed here several times for work.) I had to complain when there was a valet charge one day when I left my car out front for five minutes to drop off my briefcase after work.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great price and great location”
Reviews.Author: Ladiva0
Reviews.Content: We truely enjoyed our stay here! What a beautiful hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Terrific Staff”
Reviews.Author: Reefwatcher
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the trendy warehouse / arts district of New Orleans. It's nice to be away from the French Quarter, but I was surprised at how noisy this area can be. There's a bar directly opposite from the hotel that was mobbed on Friday night, with patrons spilling out onto the street. This, coupled with an event in the hotel's own bar/restaurant, created a chaotic and very LOUD atmosphere. And, unfortunately, my room was located directly above it all. I asked to change rooms, and to their credit, the staff accommodated my request graciously. In fact, the most impressive thing about this hotel was the staff -- they were warm, professional, and inviting from check-in to check-out. The rooms are fine, though not spectacular. The art strewn all over the hotel is whimsical and... "interesting." The roof-top pool might have been nice (though fairly small), but it was so packed with twenty-somethings that I did no more than glance at it and move on. The location is reasonably convenient, in that you're an easy walk from the World War II Museum, and only few blocks from the street car line or Canal Street. Emeril's restaurant a block away. The hotel's business center was a convenient and free way to check email or print a boarding pass, and I appreciated the "hold luggage" service on my checkout day. Once I got my room moved to the back side, away from most of the noise, I had no complaints, and the room rate was a good value for New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...pool is a let down”
Reviews.Author: oskiwow
Reviews.Content: Room and facility are nice and the location is great. Close enough to the french qtr and Canal Street, but far enough away to leave it behind when you're done. The dissapointment was the pool. Our kids were looking forward to taking a swim, but never stepped foot in. It is tiny and looks more like a petri dish. Likewise, not a lot of effort has been made to make the roof area a place where you want to spend much time. Parking is a tad pricey at $28 per night.

Reviews.Title: “A MUST STAY”
Reviews.Author: dj_hawk09
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to visit New Orleans for the first time for my birthday and in search for a hotel-we stumbled across this one on hotwire. At first I was somewhat pessimistic because of the price-but when I viewed the website I was impressed (so I booked it). On our travel, I was still "somewhat" about it-until we arrived to valet our car (nice service), check-in (professional host), and the room (looks like the demo). Everything was wonderful-quiet, a perfect location to all the spots we wanted to check out, and the artwork (kudos). We stayed for three nights and loved every moment of it. We will for sure stay here on our next visit!!!!

Reviews.Title: “One great Renaissance”
Reviews.Author: sens1992
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the New Orleans Renaissance Arts Hotel for two nights. The hotel is in a great location and perfect for a visit in New Orleans (10 minute walk to French Quarter). The hotel is pretty new and modern. The room was large and the bed was very comfortable. The restaurant was great (breakfast and dinner). The staff was helpful and friendly. We would not hesitate and book it again if in New Orleans! A bientot New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, comfortable luxury”
Reviews.Author: truffles111
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed for a fun night before attending some classes. I had requested a "nice, extra comfortable" room. And it was! Really pretty and very large. It was a double queen room with windows to the atrium. The beds were very comfortable. On arrival, we received complimentary room service of milk and cookies - yum! The bathroom was nicely decorated and clean. We really enjoyed the modern art in the common areas and spent quite awhile looking around. We went to the bar for an evening snack and service was good and food good. Every staff person that we encountered was enthusiastic and helpful. We would gladly stay there again! Only negatives: - rooftop pool area needed attention - I still object to being charged for internet use...

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Service and in need of upgrades”
Reviews.Author: phi506
Reviews.Content: As a Platinum marriott rewards member I have found the Renaissance brand to be head and shoulders above the competition in almost every instance. The Renaissance Arts Hotel on the other hand is far below the competition in almost every category. Upon checking in I asked for an upgrade due to my Platinum status and was told flatly that none were available. I inquired as to whether there was an upgrade available for purchase and was again told no very rudely. As a frequent traveler you get a sense for how full a hotel is and whether or not there should be an available upgrades. In my gut I felt there probably was and my feeling were confirmed by the assistant general manager the next day. The Bad: Badly stained carpet in the guest room. Old 27" tube TV's with a very limited channel selection. (Honestly who thinks it's a bad idea to upgrade your tv and channel selection these days?) Horrible evening and morning food presentation in Concierge lounge. Gnats all over dessert tray in Concierge lounge. Pool area littered with half eaten food and beer bottles form earlier in the day. Concierge lounge attendant on Facebook instead of attending to guests. The Good: Beautiful common areas. Easily accesible location. Assistant GM recognized problems and tried to rectify situation. We were scheduled to stay two nights and were so dissapointed that we left after the first night and went to Wind Creek resort in Atwood AL instead.

Reviews.Title: “Blood on Sheets!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mytym32
Reviews.Content: the hotel was nice and i was ejoying my stay that is until i got into bed and found blood on my sheets.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Style but lacking substance”
Reviews.Author: drrich
Reviews.Content: This new hotel looks great, is in a great location and the rooms are excellent. Ideally located between french quarter and conference centre and not noisy or at all tacky like much of city. Rooms are clean, very comfortable and the matresses guarantee a good nights sleep. Rooftop pool is a blast and the view is fabulous. Hotel let down by a very poor breakfast and poor breakfast service, I actually gave up while waiting for plates/bowls/juice or coffee. Paying for internet should be banned! Overall great but eat out!

Reviews.Title: “Consistent”
Reviews.Author: JPax
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay. Location is great. Beds are very comfortable and rooms are clean. Don't expect lots of service, but what service you do receive is friendly and competent. Best of all, you get great value for your dollar in a well maintained and comfortable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Urbane and Art Filled Warehouse District Retreat”
Reviews.Author: blissfield1949
Reviews.Content: Modern, but inviting, decor and art filled lobbies, lounges and patios make for a terrifically relaxing stay. The rooms are gorgeous and many turn inward to the art filled inner patios. The restaurant and lounge are top notch and the extrememly helpful staff are world class. The location several blocks from the convention center makes it a perfect place for those visiting New Orleans on business. It is quieter than the French Quarter but the Quarter and Canal Street are just blocks away. The St. Charles streetcar line and the World War II Museum are also nearby. A sophisticated oasis for those seeking something a bit different for their trip to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Laid Back”
Reviews.Author: TischandGina
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Renaissance New Orleans Arts Hotel in the Warehouse District. We really liked the area because it was within walking distance to many of the places we wanted to visit. Every hotel staff person we came in contact with was very pleasant and helpful, especially the bell men and valets. Service was quick and friendly. Our room had double beds and was quite comfortable. It appeared clean, but we have a habit of spraying our hotel room surfaces with disinfectant. No offense to the housekeeping staff. Still, you just never know and it's best to err on the side of caution. It was great coming back to a clean room after a long day sticking out like sore thumbs like the green tourists we were. My only complaint is that the hotel did not offer free wi-fi, and we had to pay $13 per day for wired Internet access. Them's the breaks, though. All in all, this is a great hotel and we had a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: manzoorf
Reviews.Content: From the moment we drove up to the hotel our 3 night experience here was perfect. The staff were friendly and attentive and the valet service was superb. Its an extra 32/day for Valet but well worth it to avoid the hassle of looking for parking in the busy sidewalks around this nice neighborhood so close to downtown and the French Quarter. The rooms were slightly on the small side but the decor was tasteful and the bathroom was extremely clean. The beds were very comfy although the pillows were a tad too soft. We stayed there with our 6 and 2 year old and the distance to the French Quarter and the Aquarium was less than a mile and was easy. There is a trolley to the Audobon Park/Zoo close by and the Children's Museum is 2 blocks away from the hotel. One word of advice for folks with kids is to ask for rooms away from Lucy's Bar & Grill. It was our first trip to New Orleans since Hurricane Katrina and while there are still signs of damage and economic impact from it, it was great to see many of the familiar landmarks standing tall and the city remains as vibrant as ever. As for those concerned about crime, stay within well lit and crowded areas and avoid the odd alley in the French Quarter and you should be safe.

Reviews.Title: “What's NOT to like?”
Reviews.Author: CrabGuy
Reviews.Content: My wife and spent four nights in New Orleans in early March (two weeks after the Saints won the Super Bowl and one week after Mardi Gras). The trip was a surprise gift to her in celebration of her birthday. We've been to NOLA twice before, each time for a business-related convention or conference, so it was nice to have time to just enjoy the city without business commitments. We're also dedicated "foodies," who love good food and wine, and NOLA is one of the nation's destination cities for fine dining experiences. In selecting a hotel, I generally look for three things: location, comfort and price (not always in that order). We had previously stayed at the W and the Intercontinental in the Central Business District, so I decided to look elsewhere. The French Quarter has many excellent hotels, but I found most of their prices to be too high, to say nothing of the street noise. A quick online search turned up the Renaissance Arts Hotel (Marriott) in the Warehouse District. I went through the Marriott website and found a deluxe room for $119, a price that was hard to beat. (Local and state taxes add about $18 to the base rate.) That more than satisfied my â€œpriceâ€� criteria. The Warehouse District is an "up and coming" neighborhood in the city, and young professionals, artists and gallery owners are taking advantage of low real estate prices to rebuild the area. Many industrial buildings have been converted to residential and commercial use while preserving the warehouse â€œfeel.â€� The hotel is conveniently located to the Convention Center â€“ a three-block walk. (I wish I had known about The Renaissance Arts when I was in town on business.) Itâ€™s a 10-minute walk to the Central Business District and an additional 5-minutes to the edge of the French Quarter. The Harrahâ€™s Casino is a 12-minute walk. We enjoy walking in big cities and although access to a rental car for a couple of days would have been nice, when I added up the cost of the rental, gas and overnight parking, it made more sense to walk and use mass transit. We took a cab only once â€“ to have dinner at Brigtstensâ€™s Restaurant in the River Bend area. (Well worth the trip!) For mass transit, the Canal Street streetcar is a four-block walk, the St. Charles Street line is three blocks away, and the Riverfront street car line is about four blocks from the hotel. The wonderful spring weather (sunny and 65 degrees with low humidity) made walking a real pleasure. Just be sure to wear comfortable shoes. The Warehouse District neighborhood has a wonderful assortment of dining establishments, including Tommyâ€™s Cuisine (Italian), Emerilâ€™s (Creole), Rio Mar (Spanish Seafood), Conchon (pork) and Deannieâ€™s (great breakfasts and lunches and the best shrimp Poâ€™ Boy sandwich Iâ€™ve found in NOLA), all within a short walk from the hotel. The Wine Institute of New Orleans (W.I.N.O.) is just a block away. (W.I.N.O. has 120 wines available for tasting in your choice of one, two or three once doses.) You canâ€™t beat the location. Criteria #2 satisfied. As for the hotel itself, we found it to be excellent. The building exterior preserves the original warehouse look and the interior public spaces are bright, modern and elegant. Modern works of art are prominently featured throughout the public areas, and thereâ€™s even a sculpture garden on the mezzanine level. It has the hipness of the W, without the annoying house music. We stayed in Room 412, a deluxe king room. The 450-square foot room had two windows overlooking a side street with a view of the Central Business District to the west. The room had the usual amenities: a king bed with excellent mattress and very nice linens (Iâ€™m so glad that the hotel chains are finally focusing on sleeping comfort!); a work desk with work light, phone and high-speed internet connection (there was a charge for Internet service, but we didnâ€™t use it); and a one-cup coffee maker; an ergonomic desk chair and a comfy chair and ottoman. The conventional TV, four storage drawers, a security safe and a mini-bar fridge were housed in a large armoire. Closet space was more than adequate and there were plenty of hangers for our clothes. Terry cloth robes (always a nice touch) were not provided. The room was in very good overall condition and quite comfortable. I requested foam pillows with my reservation, but the supplied pillows were feather filled. A quick call to the front desk corrected the oversight. The bathroom was bright and very clean, although it had only one sink and counter space was a bit limited for two people. The high-end toiletry items were excellent and were freshly replaced each day. The towels could have been thicker and we requested additional towels from the housekeeper on two occasions. The shower water pressure was a bit weak, but there was plenty of hot water for two morning showers. Itâ€™s my habit to leave a cash tip for housekeeping personal each day of my stay to ensure excellent service. I was not disappointed. We did not use the pool (heated outdoor), fitness center or business center, so I canâ€™t comment on those facilities. A computer station and printer were available (just off the main lobby), so we were able to print our Southwest Airlines boarding passes 24-hours before our return flight. The only disappointment was the front-end staff. There was no bellman available for assist us with our luggage on arrival, so we schlepped our own bags (no big deal). The check-in procedure was quick, although the desk clerk could have shown a little more enthusiasm in welcoming us. Check-out was excellent. We had a late afternoon flight and the hotel was able to store our luggage for several hours, enabling us to enjoy one last excellent meal in NOLA. Cabs to the airport were waiting and the bellman cheerfully assisted us with our luggage. Check off criteria #3. Overall, we found the Renaissance Arts Hotel to be excellent and would recommend the hotel to friends and business associates. Weâ€™ll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Renaissance Arts Hotel, beautiful place to stay !”
Reviews.Author: Graceland1977
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel ! As soon as you walk in, you see these great modern art sculptures and beautiful glass blown "chandeliers" ! The service is great, the bellboy brought our bags right up to our room. And the rooms are beautiful ! They look great, and they are very clean ! The beds are comfortable. I went there for Mardi Gras and went to watch the parades on St Charles Ave, and it was about a 10-15 minute walk to that street from the hotel, so that was great ! It was a longer walk to the French Quarter though, not that close, but we still managed to walk there and back without much problem. I would definitely recommend this hotel, but just keep in mind, it's a bit of a walk to the French Quarter, but all in all, great place to stay :) !

Reviews.Title: “Wondeful!”
Reviews.Author: Travlisforme
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel...a renovated mattress factory in the warehouse district. A short walk from Harrahs, Bourbon Street. Clean, great artwork, nice staff

Reviews.Title: “very nice and great location”
Reviews.Author: shotsyUsa
Reviews.Content: easy access to the hotel compared to the french quarter hotels. I've been going to N.O. for the past 30 years and have stayed at most of the name brand and boutique hotels in the city. This horl is in the up and coming arts district or known as the warehouse district. Within two blocks in either direction of the front door you'll find some of the very best resturants in the city . Across the street is Lucy's , a favorite local joint popular with some of the Saints players. The hotel is decorated with original art and is clean as a whistle . Rooms are modern and well kept. . I didn't need service or information about the area so I can't comment about the available information given out by the employees . I would stay there again . It's much better than most any of the other hotels I've stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Just the right distance from the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: steveMoline
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is on a quiet street just minutes by walking from the French Quarter. Ideal if you value a good nights sleep. The rooms are typical Renaissance in size, generous. This is a great escape Hotel. Breakfast is fine, but everything else can be found elsewhere in a more satisfying way. A comfy crash pad, not a New Orleans destination in any other way.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel: good location, good value”
Reviews.Author: PATraveler799
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in May 2009. Booked on Travelocity and got a great hotel/airfare deal. Booked a room on club level but did not get a club room upon check in, but all I had to do was let them know I had booked a club level room and my room was switched immediately. Rooms were big and clean, although a stain on the shower curtain was sort of gross. Pool was OK, nothing special, but it was nice to have a place to lounge during the day if I didn't want to go sightseeing. Close walk to the quarter although we took cabs at night (mostly because we were too stuffed to walk!). Staff was helpful and courteous. Club level was a great perk! Neat library, computer and printer access, breakfast (eggs, danish, cereal, fruit) and a fridge with soft drinks and snacks all day. Saved us money and hassle of buying bottles of water and we always had a snack on hand (not that food is in any shortage in NOLA, but sometimes you just want a banana). CLose to streetcar, AWESOME neighborhood bar across the street. I would definitely stay again. We had a blast.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: nanc64
Reviews.Content: First night one pillow & pillow case w/stain. Not enough towels. No tissue in 1 bathroom. Toilet backed up. Concierge not familiar w/restaurants within 2 blocks. In hotel services close at 11 p.m. Incorrect charge for internet on closing bill. Location good. Bellhops courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - overall poor service”
Reviews.Author: handwerpen
Reviews.Content: I agree with many other reviewers that the Renaissance Arts Hotel has a beautiful lobby with an adjacent art gallery (which is by appointment only). The hotel really fits in well with the overall area which is full of art galleries. In general, our stay was good. The room was facing the street and while I was within ear shot of Lucy's bar across the street, the noise wasn't too bad, although I could not imagine having the room right across from it. The room was spacious and bathroom ok. Nothing spectacular - your standard Marriott fare. What I don't understand is why these rooms still have an old tube tv?? Our biggest complaint is that the water in the shower/bath did not get very hot. I notified the reception 3 separate times and they said they were going to send "engineering" to look at it, but at the end of the day, I never really got hot water. Besides that, the service at the front desk + concierge is not very helpful. First of all, they are never around and never once did the the reception desk staff ask us if they could help us, even though it is very clear that there are people waiting at the concierge desk. There was staff passing us all the time, but nobody reached out to us - until the actual concierge returned. Other observations of the hotel: - Location: good. loved the area - Restaurant: did not try it - Room service: did not try it - Gym: about 6 treadmills, elipticals + free weights + a few machines - Pool: on the rooftop. It was a bit cold, but I think it would be cool to hang out there in the summer time.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly quiet oasis, unless there is a Saints game..”
Reviews.Author: Ravenduffer
Reviews.Content: You MUST ask for a quiet room away from Lucys bar across the street. There was a pimped out Red Bull Jeep outfitted with a bose stereo system blasting the Sugar Hill Gang across from hotel for about 100 tailgaters on the street before the Saints game, a huge projection TV during the game onto the side of an adjacent warehouse during and after the game, hundreds of post game fans partying outside, and a franternity enviable swath of broken beer bottles and cans the next morning.. You won't hear any of it in the back section of the hotel. This place is tasteful, has an interesting art collection, has a friendly staff, and bumped me to the just ok club room without asking. Convenient walk to Cochon Butcher, Herbsaint, Cafe Adelaide, Emerils, etc..

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Art -- Less Service at Times”
Reviews.Author: tsogl
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Arts Hotel has a beautiful lobby and is full of art work. This emphasis on art makes staying in the hotel a visually interesting experience. We generally had a good stay at this hotel. Our room was spacious. The bathroom and amenities were more than acceptable. The service at the hotel was generally very good, except for a problem we had getting additional toilet paper supplies when we were running low. We had to call down to the front desk 3 times over 3-4 hours to get someone to bring up a roll, which is not acceptable for a hotel of this quality. We also had problems with room temperature during our stay. It was very cold in New Orleans (with temperatures reaching the low twenties). The hotel heating system was not adequate to deal with this kind of weather and our room was very cold. We had no problems with Internet access during our stay (cost -- $12.00 per day with service only from noon to noon). We would recommend this hotel in normal weather conditions. If it is cold outside, however, better options may exist in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: bri11164
Reviews.Content: We traveled to NO 11/26/09-12/1/09 and stayed at this hotel for the entire stay. It is a 35min/$30 cab ride from the airport to the hotel. We traveled strictly for leisure/tourist purposes. LOCATION: The hotel is in a good location. It is 4 blocks from canal street. 6 blocks from bourbon street. 5 Blocks from Riverwalk and Harrah's casino. We went to the Saints/Pats game and it was about 8 blocks to the Superdome. It is 3 blocks to the St Charles St trolley and as mention 4 blocks to the Canal St trolley. 10 minute walk to bourbon street and 20 minute walk to lower french quarter. Close enough to the activity yet you are not right in the middle of it at night when you are trying to sleep. Never felt unsafe the whole trip even while wearing colors of the opposing NE Pats. We walked everywhere, using just the Riverwalk trollery once (at bottom of Canal street) to take us to the lower french quarter for only $1.25/passenger per ride. STAFF: treated very professionally and pleasantly by staff members at front desk and the valet staff. Did not use room service. Also, had a snack/drink in the hotel restaurant and our needs were attended to adequately. Hotel restaurant is pricey for drinks and food. ROOM: We had king size room on 4th floor (there are only 5) that faced the Mississippi, however there was a taller building blocking our view of the river. Older picture tube 25inch TV with remote. There was a compact size refrigerator which we used for storing drinks which was nice. Plenty of space. Separate chair/ottoman. And a desk with internet hookup. This floor houses their club/membership rooms, of which we did not get one, those rooms have free internet and even though we didn't get one I was able to pick up a wireless signal from them and did not have to pay for internet service which I believe was $12/day if you hook up to it. Bathroom was a little smaller than average size for a 3 1/2-4* hotel as it is listed on most travel websites. Shower/tub combo with adequate water pressure. Room was fairly clean. Small carpet stain was only negative I could find. Very quiet sleeping even though there were other guests in the rooms on both sides of us. Bed has firm/comfortable mattress. Pillows were a bit small but plentiful. Did not utilize the rooftop pool or the fitness center. We pricelined this hotel and got a $105/night rate for which I think we got a great deal given quality/location of hotel. If you don't like to walk to sights don't stay here. There are hotels closer to the French Quarter/Bourbon St area. I would definitely stay here again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place and people”
Reviews.Author: Qarqour
Reviews.Content: I recently hosted a meeting at the Renaissance Arts. The people could not have been nicer, from the catering department and staff, to the front desk clerks and porters, to the valets. The rooms and the entire hotel were clean and modern. Cleaning staff were impeccable. The food and service provided for our meetings were first class, and this hotel is very centrally located - near the convention center and near the French Quarter. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “BEST STAY EVER”
Reviews.Author: Berthapar
Reviews.Content: We had to travel to New Orleans for a conference at the convention center and booked this hotel primarily because it had received so many good reviews from this and similar websites. We thought we would take a chance on it being that it is close to the convention center and the walk to the French quarters is not that far. I have to say this is one of the best hotels Iâ€™ve been to in New Orleans. The rooms are very comfortable and clean (the beds are tremendousâ€¦very nice). The hotel is beautiful, with the art work and sculptured lighting. We had a mix up with the debit card we used to pay for the room and the manager worked extremely hard to make sure the issue was resolved with the bank, even though the bank was at fault. She made sure that we were taken care of. Iâ€™ve stayed in numerous hotels in New Orleans, and the manager and staff at this hotel are some of the nicest Iâ€™ve ever met. Weâ€™ve had to deal with some very snotty staff at other hotels, but not at this one. I am so happy i chose the renaissance arts hotel. It is one of the best youâ€™ll find in New Orleans. Iâ€™ll definitely stay there againâ€¦.hopefully soon. I loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but lacking....”
Reviews.Author: ajlcdl
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by a friend who stayed here and was one of the only hotels in this area of NO to get consistently good reviews. It was OK. The location can't be beat, and the staff was friendly but uninformative. For example, being an early riser from the East Coast, early coffee is important. When we checked in and asked the registration clerk where to get coffee in the early morning, she didn't know, and then checked with a colleague who recommended PJs, a couple of blocks away, although neither mentioned that the hotel provides complementary coffee in the bar area. The room was nice, but the shower pressure was almost nonexistent, the coffee maker in the room was the crappy pod variety, and there is no fridge for dinner leftovers. THere is a noisy late night bar right across the street from the hotel so make sure if you stay here, request a room on the other side. One nice touch is the complementary business room to print out boarding passes and check the internet, because in the room it costs 12.99 a day. The fitenss center was just OK, with good treadmills but not a lot of weight machines. Overalll I wouldn't stay here again - there are better options in this area.

Reviews.Title: “As safe as home”
Reviews.Author: ThePrintSurgeon
Reviews.Content: After flying into New Orleans for a trade show and working until the early evening hours I was taken to the Renaissance Arts Hotel in New Orleans. From the time my cab door was opened I felt comfortable, welcomed and appreciated. I enjoyed a very well appointed and comfortable room for the next four days and after my time there was sad to leave. The staff at the front desk were prompt and courteous, well informed about the city and local sights. The restaurant in the hotel was superb, I ate breakfast there every morning and even dined in with room service on my last night. The most amazing moment during my stay was the day I asked for a 7 am wake-up call with a 15 minute follow-up. I answered the wake-up call that was made by a real person and not a machine. I quickly got started with a shower forgetting about the follow-up call. To my amazement I heard the doorbell ring and security was asking if I was alright. Imagine that, being checked on when I failed to answer the second time! I was stunned, surprised and felt very, very secure after that. After getting dressed I stopped by the front desk and asked to speak to the head of hotel security, they explained the failure to answer my follow-up call meant I could have overslept, been hurt, fallen in the shower or any number of things. I will return to New Orleans again in the near future and when I do I'll be at The Renaissance Arts Hotel, where it feels as safe as home.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this place”
Reviews.Author: GRoss1806
Reviews.Content: Just back from our 2nd weekend in New Orleans this year. Last time around we stayed at Le Pavilion, but we think this hotel is much better. The hotel is perfectly placed for main attractions (everything within a few minutes walk), but in a quiet part of town that allows you some peace and quiet. The decor of the hotel is very unusual but nice and the rooms were spacious and clean. Service from the staff was first class. All in all next time we're in town, this is where we'll be staying.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Getaway Weekend”
Reviews.Author: RegTex
Reviews.Content: Superb Service and Accomodations on our 4th anniversary. The first room we checked into had obviously had smokers in it. We called the front desk and they immediately moved us into a bigger room. They definitely went the extra mile.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Great Location - Super Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: rickFPP
Reviews.Content: This is a great choice in New Orleans. Rooms were very nice in size with large bathrooms and an executive desk with ergo chair. King Bed was very comfortable with ample pillows and blankets. Truly a first class sleeping room. The hotel is just one block from Emeril's New Orleans and just a block from the Wine Institute of New Orleans (WINOs). Very safe area and easy walking distance to all of the downtown attractions. Harrahs Casino within eight blocks - Bourbon Street within ten blocks - St. Charles Streetcar just five blocs away. The staff went out of their way to please. Be sure to ask for a 'corner room' - these gets you windows on two sides. Room service breakfast was pricey, but arrived in less than 10 minutes on the week-end. Suggestion. Do NOT drive here as the parking fee is $28.00 per night. i did see a lot about two blocks away with a $15/nightly charge.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, stylish stay”
Reviews.Author: ncdhwb
Reviews.Content: A "stay two nights, get one free" deal on hotels.com for the Renaissance Arts made this hotel significantly cheaper than the majority of its competition and was the deciding factor in our decision to stay there. It ended up being quite a bargain! The rooftop, complete with open-air pool, hot tub and seating areas, was a highlight for us. Also great was the fitness center. The hotel provides free chilled towels and even apples for after workouts, and the cardio machines all feature individual TVs. Our room was large, and the tall, striped headboard on the bed was a fun departure from rooms at other hotels. Personally, I thought the mattress was a bit too firm, but my husband said he slept really well on it. The staff was always very polite when we needed anything. The hotel does seem committed to giving artwork a place of prominence, but unfortunately both the sculpture garden and the art gallery were closed to visitors during our stay, except apparently by appointment. Granted, it was still possible to see the art they contained from outside their gates, but it was disappointing not be be able to get closer at our leisure. As other reviewers have mentioned, the daily valet parking fee is close to $30, but our free night evened the cost out. As far as location goes, the hotel is about a 15-minute walk to Jackson Square in the French Quarter. It's not a bad walk at all, but it is something to be aware of. The hotel seemed to be in a safe part of town, but we kept our guard up and walked quickly when heading back after dark just to be safe and never had any problems. Overall, we had a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, couple of caveats”
Reviews.Author: saracHouston
Reviews.Content: It's a bit out of the way of the main action of New Orleans, but that's the only issue one could have with this lovely hotel. The room was nicely decorated and spacious. Service was friendly and helpful. They could stand to turn the air down a bit; the lobby and room was freezing. Note: Valet parking only, and it costs $28 a day. Got it for a great price on Priceline. Also: really needs free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for NOLA cruise passengers!”
Reviews.Author: hfitzger
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Renaissance Arts New Orleans as part of their cruise package rate. The hotel itself is beautiful with art everywhere in the lobby and the commons areas, and the staff was very friendly. As a family with young children, we did not feel uncomfortable as we have in some other boutique hotels. I had requested a quiet room in my reservation and had verified it with the check-in desk upon arrival. We were upgraded to the club floor where we had access to the club lounge with complimentary snacks and breakfast. We also had a room that faced to the outside instead of their inside courtyard. This turned out to be a blessing since there was a huge block party/hotel party in the lobby on Saturday night and once we were in our room, we didn't hear a thing! The club rooms may be more soundproof than regular rooms... The rooms were beautifully appointed and the rooftop pool/Jacuzzi and sitting areas were a quiet place to go in the evening to absorb the view of New Orleans. It was about a 10-15 minute walk (with children) to Canal Street and the start of the French Quarter. As a previous reviewer mentioned, sidewalks are not always maintained, so it may be hard to push a stroller the whole way to the city's attractions. The hotel is situated in the quiet warehouse/arts district so it is away from the party atmosphere of the FQ, but still close enough to walk to visit. The New Orleans Convention & Visitors Bureau has a page with several hotels offering packages for cruise passengers, and the Renaissance Arts offers a rate of $109 with free parking for up to 8 days. Their normal per day charge of $28 for valet parking is charged for all other rates. I don't think many people book this rate, because when we were charged for parking upon check-out, I had to bring it to the manager's attention with my confirmation, but it was quickly and easily taken care of...

Reviews.Title: “Last trip of the Summer”
Reviews.Author: fposoftballmom
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter picked this hotel based on the pictures from the website. A lot of times website pictures are not current up to date pictures well not in this case. This hotel was beautiful, the staff was very friendly, the room was small but very comfortable. This hotel is located in walking distances any where you want to go literally. We walked a mile to the Garden District took 30 minutes tops. The only down side I can see is the the cost to valet park $28 per day on top of the cost of the hotel just seemed a little pricey. All in all we loved the hotel and enjoyed looking at all the neat decorations in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “We like this hotel”
Reviews.Author: virginiarapids
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Arts Hotel has an impressive lobby and public area with various artwork. Some rooms have exposed brick walls, although we didn't have this on our last visit. Room was nicely furnished and very clean. On last visit we had an inside room--not bad since our view was of a pleasant interior area with artwork. But we heard some noise late at night from people apparently partying. Swimming pool area is on top floor with impressive city views. Nice set up although the pool is on the small side. The hotel restaurant serves an excellent breakfast. Lunch was also tasty and the bar area serves some yummy desserts. We also have fond memories of the other Renaissance in New Orleans, the Renaissance Pere Marquette, while volunteering in the Tulane Medical School area in 2006.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: usckim01
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Arts Hotel was perfect for what I was looking for. We were looking for a hotel with character, away from Bourbon St but close enough to walk to FQ, comfortable and clean rooms, good service. I was a little sad that my view was of the lobby rather than outside, but we barely spent any time in the hotel, so it worked out fine. We came here for JazzFest and I had heard that many hotels in New Orleans can be on the older side (aka a bit run down) and expensive. This hotel dispelled those rumors. I thought it was great value for what we got.

Reviews.Title: “...it was just ok for a Renaissance Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NYSpeedRacer
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Arts Hotel was good, but I felt that they were trying too hard. The rooms were decent and spacious. The location was perfect, as I was for work as part of the Essence Festival. The valet service needed an attitude adjustment. Chris was great, but the others were borderline rude when I was dropping off and picking up my vehicle. The way they greeted me was not what I expected. Definitely not living up to the Renaissance name. The hotel staff was very cordial.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: a visitor from ireland
Reviews.Content: Great location, Great Staff but very poor value for money. Twice the price of any other hotel we stayed during our trip and the one with the poorest offering. No breakfast included and only available delivered to the room at a substantial price if requested, â‚¬28 a day parking, no refrigerator in the room, no free wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel and HUGE rooms made this a great stay.”
Reviews.Author: Dznygrl
Reviews.Content: I won this hotel on a Priceline bid, as I needed a crashpad after a family wedding. Hotel is centrally located in the warehouse district, close to Convention Center, Riverwalk, Harrah's, Canal, and only a few blocks to the French Quarter. Positives: Every staff member we interacted with was friendly, professional and extremly helpful. Our 4th floor room overlooked an interior courtyard which, due to extensive skylights, felt like we were looking outdoors. The room was HUGE with 2 queen beds, luxury linens, workspace, walk in closet and large bathroom. Negatives: Parking was very expensive ($28+tax) and there really wasn't a safe alternative. Wired and expensive internet connection in the room - it's time to upgrade to free wifi! All in all, a very positive experience and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: gjob
Reviews.Content: I was really disappointed with this hotel, The rooms area just not up to current standards you can get in other hotels for the same or even cheaper price. Firstly a charge for wifi in this day & age is ridiculous. Considering the heat experienced in New Orleans I found it astounding that there was no fridge in our room - there was a space for it however. There was a strong smell of cigarette smoke in the corridor all the time even though the hotel is non smoking. However it must be said that the staff were excellent form the reception to the valet parking- this along with the lobby decor are the only redeeming features of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: JeanPasadenaCA
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel about 4 blocks from the convention center. About 15 minutes walk from the French Market and Cafe Du Monde. Nice decor in the lobby and the room. No concierge but the people at the front desk were always helpful. Wired internet in the rooms. Wireless would have been more convenient. Overall, a very nice hotel. I stayed in a room on the 4th floor facing the street but was not in the Club Section with all the amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great price, great location”
Reviews.Author: curlygirlNewYork
Reviews.Content: Our 6th time in New Orleans - never stayed in the Wharehouse District. This was a pleasant surprise. Our room was Huge! Very clean. The lobby and common areas have beautiful art especially the hand blown glass hanging lamps. It's about a 15 minute walk to the street car which takes you right into the French Quarter. The only complaint we had was slowness and inattentiveness of the help at the beautiful bar and restaurant. Great rooftop pool.

Reviews.Title: “marvelous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: carolAtlanta
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from 3 days at this hotel and it was fabulous! Lots of unexpected extras. We stayed on the Club Level, and the room had a refrigerator, a beautiful view of the city from the room as well as from the rooftop, and hot breakfast in the Club Lounge as well as delicious appetizers at night. The staff was very accomodating when we asked for a late checkout. The pool and hot tub are on the roof - lots of fun. The location is about a 10 min. walk to the French Quarter straight up Tchoupitoulas Street. We enjoyed the location very much. It's quite near Harrah's casino and the convention center, and is surrounded by good restaurants. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FirstClassOne
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one night but we enjoyed it very much. Was not sure what to expect, but was pleasantly surprised with everything. Lobby was beautiful and filled with interesting artwork. Stayed in a room with an exterior view on the 4th floor. It was large, clean, nicely updated and quiet. Lots of windows letting in plenty of light. Liked the electronic do not disturb /make up room sign. Very comfortable bed. Only negative would be the bathroom seemed a little small and the toilet was rather sluggish. Hotel is located in a quiet area, but still close to everything. Walking distance to the FQ, riverfront, casino and convention center. Plenty of restaurants within a block or two. Best thing... only paid $52 on PriceLine .

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious without the High Price Tag”
Reviews.Author: Kabear
Reviews.Content: We were there for three nights and it was a good choice in the Warehouse/Arts District, just west of the French Quarter. The staff was very helpful. Quiet, very comfortable bed, large closet, soft tissues & toilet paper and fluffy soft towels. Large bathroom with expansive granite counter top for your personal toiletries. First rate hotel at budget prices. We walked everywhere. There is a Club Room on the 4th Floor which is a nice lounge with a TV, library, computer, complimentary beverages (coffee, tea, juice, bottled water, etc.), fresh fruit, pastries, etc. in the early morning and then other stuff in the early evening. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Top of the Line in Every Way”
Reviews.Author: debijo61
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, attentive staff, comfy bed with down pillows and comforter, close to French Quarter, rooftop pool, and great top of the line toiletries. Everything was perfect. Bellhops were wonderful. I felt like a queen being waited on all week, doors opened for me, packages being carried in, etc. So nice. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful deal in a good location with great service”
Reviews.Author: patsychom
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel with very good staff - professional and helpful. It's walking distance to the Quarter and easy to access the main streets. I was especially impressed with the service - staff were always cheerful and willing to help. I got a great price which made it an excellent value. The food in the restaurant was very good. I certainly will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Getaway!!!”
Reviews.Author: lsumccoy
Reviews.Content: Living in Louisiana, I have been to New Orleans numerous times. Wanting to take my wife for a weekend getaway form the kids, and not wanting to stay in the Quarter(usuall very noisy), I decided to try this hotel. I could not have been more surprise. Upon arriving, the valet attendant was there as I stepped out of my car. I was a little early checkin in, no problem. Our room was a very nicely appointed kingsize room. Although we did not spen much time in the hotel, the bed was very comfortable. The room walls were obviously thin, as we could hear our neighbors when we would stop by during the day to drop off our goodies we picked up shopping. The location was great. A nice short walk anywhere you wanted to go. And at night to get around, a cab was always ready at the cab stand, not so at other hotels I have stayed at. And to top it all off, the rate was only 60.00 a night. WOW!! Try getting that in New Orleans at a 4 star hotel in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and all that ART!!!”
Reviews.Author: fjon
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay and I must say we "lucked out"....this hotel is in the best location.....we don't mind walking...so 4 blocks to the convention center, 8 blocks to the French Quarter, 3-4 blocks to the financial district, and a nice 2 mile stroll to the garden district. Loved the rooftop pool...as it had unobstructive views of the city and unobstructive sun (most other hotel rooftop pools are shaded for most of the day).....after a long walk...it was nice to come back and relax there. Loved the Art/Warehouse district and all the art galleries...be sure to check them out. And the hotel itself is a wonderful art gallery....what a great job they did designing this old converted warehouse... There are some great nearby restaurants and although everyone seems to like Lucy's across the street....we had lousy service and the food was terrible (perhaps an off-night?). Try the hotel restaurant...gret seafood! A few negative issues...room was not the cleanest......we could tell they never vacuumed the room for 3 days.....that crumb was still there!!! Rugs needed shampooing. We were fortunate enough to have club lounge access and we thought the morning continental b-fast options were not too good...they did serve something hot each morning....but when it ran out....you had to keep asking to replenish the food....ended up going to the hotel restaurant for b-fast where food and service was much better. The staff were very friendly and overall very accomodating... Be careful walking at night....it is a dangerous city and had heard reports of people being robbed at gunpoint in the FQ. Would definitely return to this hotel again and again....

Reviews.Title: “A True Gem in the Heart of New Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELMATES2005
Reviews.Content: My wife, one-year-old child, and I stayed in the Marriott Renaissance Arts Hotel in March of 2009. We stayed for 3 days, and our experience from valet to checkout was absolutely wonderful. The hotel lobby is very contemporary and elaborate. Check-in took all of 5 minutes. There is a small room to the right of the check-in desk with snacks, drinks, disposable cameras, and an ATM. Soft drink and ice machines are also located on each floor near the elevator. Our room was on the 4th floor in the Club Lounge area. For those of you with access to this level, you can obtain free soft drinks and water from this area as well as having a continental breakfast, including scrambled eggs, everyday except Saturday and Sunday. The lounge offers hors dâ€™oeuvres during meal times as well as free Internet access, television, and books to read. There is also a restaurant adjoining the hotel lobby, which is quite elegant, but we were dressed casual when we ate there for breakfast, as the restaurant was not very busy. The breakfast buffet was around 16 dollars and featured sausage, bacon, pastries, juice, cereal, and made to order eggs. The fifth floor has an exercise area with several elliptical machines and a few weight lifting stations. On this same floor, proceed out the door to the right to access the pool and hot tub area, which has several seating areas, arranged with a beautiful view of the New Orleans skyline. Be aware that this area has a room key access to return to the building, so donâ€™t forget your room key or you may be on the roof for a while enjoying the view. There was a king-sized bed in our room, which was soft and comfortable. The entertainment-center featured free cable with HBO and of course my favorite, webtv Internet access as well as a huge in-room movie selection. There was also a small refrigerator and a digital safe inside the entertainment center. Internet access from your own computer could be obtained for 12.95 per day. The air conditioner works very well and is controlled by a digital thermostat. There is a small business area in the corner of the room outfitted with a nice table, chair, and coffee maker. The closet is large enough for a small familyâ€™s clothing. This is where the iron and ironing board are stored. We found the bathroom area to be quite nice featuring a dresser-like sink stand with granite counter tops as well as a nice size bathtub with a diffusing shower cap. There is a large window in the room with a view of the small side street and adjacent building. Our room was very clean and there is a digital do-not-disturb button located next to the door, which was quite nice. The valet was obtained by a phone call to the front desk. Our car was ready within 5 minutes of the call and was always waiting for us by the time we made it downstairs. We were in and out of the hotel three or four times per day and the valetâ€™s were always courteous. I highly recommend the valet service due to the fact that the other option is a Central Parking managed area located about a block from the hotel with no in and out privilege. This parking area does not offer an attendant, but has a computerized ticketing system and the overnight rate was 28 dollars, which is the same price as the hotel valet service. It was much more convenient having our car brought to the front door. We were in New Orleans for the NSTA convention and this hotel is only about three blocks from the convention center. We made the walk one morning with our child in his stroller, which was quite nice. The only other advice I can offer is to remember to look up when searching for this hotel. The only sign for the hotel is located on top of the building. We passed it up several times before locating it. As stated before, this hotel is absolutely wonderful, and we look forward to more stays with the Marriott organization.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel...lovely, comfortable w/ a very good restaurant & location”
Reviews.Author: mrvandelay
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for about 100+ nights in 2007 and 2008. Really like the place and have zero negative issues. Hotel is very well-maintained with sublime design elements that make it a cut above others in this price range. If you are lucky enough to gain access to the concierge lounge, you will find a very comfortable room, well appointed with a den area, reading nook, flat screen TV, and really good food (morning and evening) and assisted by helpful attendants. The lobby restaurant has a wonderful staff and knows what customer service is...and the food is terrific. The rooms are beautiful with the high ceilings and huge windows, especially the suites and corner rooms. The top floor gym is rather complete and very good. The location puts it within blocks of the best restaurants in the U.S., including Emeril's and August plus cool little bars and dives. This is in the warehouse district, a relatively safe part of NOLA with businesses, restaurants and loft apartments throughout. TIP: pretty easy to find free parking on the street in the area

Reviews.Title: “just vacuum the public areas and everything would have been perfect!”
Reviews.Author: 2Dackels
Reviews.Content: Great location, great big & quiet rooms, friendly staff, okay restaurant (fabulous places w/in walking distance), but need to vacuum the carpets in the public areas more frequently. I would definitely stay here again, particularly for the $55/nt rate I got on Priceline.com.

Reviews.Title: “Ups and Downs”
Reviews.Author: Grommit7
Reviews.Content: I travel extensively and am quite particular. The Renaissance Arts has some terrific qualities, but also some pitfalls. We arrived early and had no expectation of checking in early--but we had great service from Nathalie at the front desk. I had called earlier in the week to request a exterior king corner room as I had heard that these rooms were bigger and quieter. The person I spoke with indicated a note would be made on my reservation and that it would be no problem, albeit, she sounded ambivilent. Upon arrival, Nathalie noted that there were no notes on the reservation and she indicated that no king beds would be available during our stay. After expressing my disappointment, Nathalie was able to unblock an exterior corner king. The room was blocked because it was to have some carpet sections replaced. The room clearly needed to have some carpeting replaced. My sense is that some rooms have already been through this process--hence the reviews about no carpet stains. Ours was pretty stained and torn up--so it's good they'll be replacing. The duvet in our room was also stained and looked like it needed to be changed. Again, Nathalie was the only real standout on the staff--most were aloof at best--especially the bell staff. The location is good--much quieter than in the Quarter and if you can get a good rate, you should opt for this hotel. Room service was average--not what we ordered, but we were tired and just went with it. Visit Lucy's across the street--a retired surfer bar--fun!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: willtravelforfun45
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed March 6 thru 9 and had a wonderful time. The hotel and staff were unbelievable. The lobby was clean and beautiful and was decorated in an artsy feel. The staff greeted us as if they had known us forever and were all to happy to help with anything. The rooms were beautiful, well appointed and clean. The only thing I would have changed is the shower head. If you like rain shower you are set. If you like the shower head to peel paint you might be a ittle disappointed. Also, I felt parking($28.00) a night was a little excessive but since I named my price on price line($50.00) a night the parking didn't seem so bad. Across the street there is a popular locals bar with great pub grub. My wfe had chicken Quesadillias (best guac ever) and I had the best hot wings I had ever eaten. You are a 4 to 6 block walk to bourbon (short walk) or an 8 to 10 dollar cab ride. About the cabs, the cab drivers add a 1 to 3 dollar extra fee to the ride (check the extras window in the meter). They do not tell you this...you have to figure it out on your own. Therefore I did not feel the need to tip. Normally I tip well to service industry but hate it when they decide their own tip. In this case their loss. Take the walk to bourbon. Its safe and a fun way to see prople and things. Beware of the brewhouse $21.00 for 2 beers. Look for beverage specials up and down Bourbon. Alot of 2 for 1 and 3 for 1. Also huge #@$ beers for 4 dollars and 2 dollar shots. Also check out Jackson Square and St Johns Cathedral from behind(at night) for an awesome sight. Have a great time...we did.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, Decent location watch out for $28 parking fee.”
Reviews.Author: TampaDave
Reviews.Content: Call me old fashioned but shouldn't hotel parking be FREE for guests? Or at least discounted? Not at this Renaissance hotel. You pull up to the front to unload your car and they sort of have the $28 sign hidden so if you have them park your car, and of course why wouldn't you, you're staying at the hotel? You find out later that they bill your room $28 per night for parking. This is price gouging and I find it a bit outrageous. How about just charging me another $10 for the room per day and giving me free parking? The room itself was ok, quiet but the carpet was dirty and this should be for a Renaissance. Clean those carpets and get your act together Marriot.. The quarter is about a ten minute walk so wear comfortable shoes.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: ctandsn
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights during our Mardi Gras visit. Room and bed was comfortable--no specific complaints there. Parking (valet only) is $28 per night plus tax (there are no self parking available). Attendants for the valet parking were very nice, while the ones at the front desk are just informative, nothing else (they didn't go the extra mile to make you feel welcome). 10minute to the riverwalk. 15minute walk to the french quarters. got a great deal on priceline.com. no free internet in your room but it is free if you use the internet in their business office.

Reviews.Title: “A fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: reelmaster
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled to New Orleans in February, 2009 and I chose this hotel after reading hundreds of TA reviews on other hotels in the city. The first great thing about this hotel (for us anyway) is that it's away from the Bourbon Street madness. The location is perfect. It's quiet, safe and a 5-10 minute cab ride into the French Quarter. It's also walking distance to the Convention Center. There are good restaurants within walking distance and a corner store close by if you want to buy some snacks, beer or liquor to take back to your room. The hotel is spotless and our room was immaculate with fresh clean sheets and a very comfortable bed. The hotel employees were very personable and the service was excellent. There is a pretty good restaurant in the hotel lobby, however, their service is a bit slow. The only negative that I can think of has already been mentioned here on TA and that's the "thin walls" that some have mentioned. It was quite easy to hear our neighbors TV but he went to bed early and the good news is most of the loud and obnoxious folks are staying over on Bourbon Street! Overall, The Renaissance Arts was a great choice and should we return to New Orleans, this hotel will be at the top of our list.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: dedesinsarasota
Reviews.Content: Outstanding accommodation! The room was spotlessly clean. The staff was more than helpful. The location is central to anything you want to do. We would absolutely stay here again and have no problems recommending it. They just need more help in the restaurant in the morning. Otherwise, top notch!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Renaissance Arts”
Reviews.Content: The staff is what makes this hotel such an amazing place to visit. We just returned from a two night stay at the Renaissance Arts Hotel in the Arts/Warehouse District. Rhenea the front desk manager greeted us with a huge welcome and smile and we knew we were off to a great start. We booked through a discount site and were amazed that we were treated so professionally and warmly. Our room was on the fourth floor and not near any ice machines and elevators.The room was very large with a good size bathroom with marble type counters and two sinks. The hotel is really pretty and filled with art work. Down the street is Tommy's Italian/Creole restaurant. Food was good but we were seated at the worst table in the house. A pole was next to our table and a thin wall seperated us from the Dishwasher! The constant sound of the dishwasher, clanging glassware and noise put a definite damper on our dinner. The place was packed and after a day of travel I was too tired to move. The waitstaff was extremely attentive and friendly. Down the block is Emerill's restaurant also. Didn't try it as it is pricey and I didn't want to try it. Lucy's a fun surf bar across the street had 8 dollar hamburgers and other bar food. Service was great and food was reasonable and tastey. The French quarter is a 15 minute walk and we would walk there and take a cab back. Cab fare was $7.50 for 2. Trolley stop at St. Charles and Julia was close by. It costs 1.25 a person exact change only. We took the Cajun tours/Honey Island Swamp tour booked through the hotel. It costs 49 dollars and AAA discount is 2 dollars off each person. The bus picks you right up at the hotel. During the colder weather there aren't many alligators to see. My daughter enjoyed it but I wouldn't recommend it during the colder months. Saw just a few small baby alligators. Driver will drop you off in Downtown French Quarter if you like on the way back. Bus driver was very prompt and professional. We took the Celebration Tours City/Katrina tour. It is approximately 3 hours and very informative. Mike Marino our tour guide spoke constantly never taking a break. Bordered on giving me a headache but overall a great tour. A small van with a maximum room for 14 people, cost of 49 dollars. Look for coupons in the New Orleans guide which you can order for free online and save 10 dollars each. They pick you up very promptly at the hotel and will drop you off downtown on the way to dropping folks off at the hotel. Very professional people run this operation. Cab service to the airport and back is $30 each way for two people. I would definitely go back to this hotel if I return to New Orleans. The staff went above and beyond in helping us with information and recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “It Certainly Lives up to the Renaissance Brand Name!”
Reviews.Author: SueFee
Reviews.Content: We decided to spend a night in New Orleans while on a road trip. Since we are Marriott Rewards members, we looked at what Marriott properties were available for that night. Only 3 were showing availability and we chose the Renaissance Arts Hotel because 1) it had a good nightly rate and 2) we've had great experiences in other Renaissance hotels. We weren't disappointed at all! As other reviewers pointed out the rooms were quite large. However, surprisingly, the bathroom, although nicely appointed, was small. We were also pleasantly surprised to find a refrigerator in the room. The room was very clean and comfortable. The bed was on the soft side but still comfortable with good quality bedding. We found the hotel to be very quiet at night and were able to sleep well. The only glitch we encountered (and it turned out to be minor but did give us a bit of a scare) was a problem with the valet parking. When we checked in, we went to the valet and he told us that he didn't think there were any spaces available! When we expressed our displeasure, he then assured us that he would find a spot---even if we had to leave the car outside the hotel all night. The desk clerk told us if that happened, the car wouldn't be towed. As it turned out, he did find a spot and the car was returned to us the next day without any problems. In fact, we didn't have much of a wait to get it, either, despite the valet warning us that there may well be a wait in the morning. Would we stay here again? Certainly! However, we agree we would try to visit when we didn't have to drive---not just for the valet issues but, like any large city, negotiating the traffic wasn't fun.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: DanBNash
Reviews.Content: You can see why this hotel receives such excellent ratings. We received a great deal booking directly on the Marriott website. In addition we received 25% off a 3 night stay as Marriott rewards members. We stayed December 26,27,28, 2008. The location in the arts/warehouse district was perfect. There are many great restaurants in the area and the French Quarter is just a short walk away. This is a quieter area and the Renaissance Arts offers good sized rooms and great amenities. One of our travellers used the gym and the rooftop pool would be perfect for warmer weather. We also rented a car from Hertz a couple blocks away on Convention Center Blvd. You save the airport rental car fees and can drop the car off very easily. Sometimes a cheap rate means low-quality services but we received wine and cheese in our room and a free breakfast. This is a great option for anyone who wants a slower paced trip to New Orleans. We would definitely stay there again. DanB

Reviews.Title: “Class Act”
Reviews.Author: harleybonz
Reviews.Content: I don't know why this hotel is so far down in the ranking .We're trying to stay at all the high ranked hotels in New Orleans and I can tell you this one belongs up at the top.This is one of the cleanest hotels we ever stayed.Great service,clean and modern rooms.,and a hot tub and pool on the roof.Also a workout room..The location is good ,very quiet area ,not too far from the action.I would highly recommend this hotel....

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Oasis in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: voorheesians
Reviews.Content: This was my seventh visit to New Orleans, and my second stay at the Renaissance Arts Hotel on Tchoupitoulas Street. What a GREAT place to stay - clean, luxurious, and with excellent staff/service. The rooms are great size (even the standard ones). The lobby boasts ever-changing artwork and access to the Albert Ross art gallery next door. It's super-convenient to the convention center, but no-one going to conventions there seems to know about it! All the better - it truly is an oasis. It's about a 5 minute walk to the French Quarter, so you can party on Bourbon Street without having your hotel in the middle of the partying! Great roof-top pool and excellent fitness facility too. I have no complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Recommended - would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: calgaryjetgirl
Reviews.Content: We came to New Orleans for the 2008 Voodoo Festival and then stayed into the following week. We had requested an upper floor with a King bed but at check in they only had double beds available. We were advised to try the front desk the following day as people would be checking out, perhaps we could get a king bed. We ended up on the 4th floor on the Club or Concierge side. We didn't even think about trying to get in until the next morning and low and behold we had access, very pleasant surprise. This saved us buying breakfast every morning as well as providing pop and snacks in the evening. The room was an inside room as well which was very pleasant and ultimately we decided not to try and move. The housekeeping was top notch, very clean and efficient. The room itself was a good size, well decorated and clean. The only downside to our stay was the Starbucks convention that was in town. Our hotel had a large number of attendees staying and they were loud. The location was great, good restaurants in the area and quick easy walk to the quarter. I would definitely recommend the hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing Oasis in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Almond66
Reviews.Content: I travel to New Orleans a fair bit and for different reasons. When I know that having a very restful comfortable stay is important, I look forward to staying at the Renaissance Arts. It is a very clean, very modern, quiet and an incredibly relaxing hotel. I've stayed at many hotels in New Orleans 4 star upwards and this is the one hotel with the most consistent positive experience. It is walking distance to the convention center. If your goal is to party it up in the French Quarter, it might not be the place for you as its not walking distance. Otherwise, I see no downsides to staying here. Great climate control, great bathroom and amenities, very very comfortable bed. In addition, very few hotels in new Orleans are as quiet as this one.

Reviews.Title: “incredible service, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: vonschwind
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Renaissance Arts Hotel in New Orleans for 4 nights in September, 2008 while attending a conference. My stay was excellent, and the staff of this hotel were consistently helpful, friendly, and attentive. I stayed in a room with two double beds, which I shared with a colleague. We found the space ample, the beds very comfortable, the TV selection good, all needed amenities. The mini-fridge in the room was locked, and when I called the front desk, they said that they had discontinued using the ones installed in the room, but immediately offered to bring up another for us. We loved the coffee and the bath products by Lather, which were completely restocked each day. Very comfortable, soft towels also. Climate control was excellent, very efficient A/C. The location of the hotel was ideal, very close to the site of the conference I was attending (by the convention center), but significantly cheaper than the actual conference hotel (and closer to the nightlife). There is a rooftop patio and pool, where I sat to work one evening with my laptop and watched a gorgeous sunset. There are great restaurants on the same street or very close by, including Cochon (highly recommend), and also a wonderful self-serve wine bar called WINO (very highly recommend). The staff at the hotel were amazing and saved my life, practically, on several occasions. At one point, I visited the Business Center on the ground floor to print a presentation text for the conference. The printer seemed to be having issues, so I stuck my head in the business office for assistance. A wonderfully sweet and helpful woman named Erica immediately interrupted her work and came to my rescue, and using my flash drive, she printed the presentation for me on the computer in her office, all in a matter of minutes. A true lifesaver! On the morning of my departure, the Airport Shuttle failed to arrive to pick me up, and the crew at the hotelâ€™s front desk immediately took on the responsibility of calling the Shuttle office repeatedly until they got a response, demanding that the Shuttle come back and pick me up, all so that I wouldnâ€™t have to pay extra for a taxi. They were fantastic and made a potentially stressful situation very easy. Also, Renee at the front desk, who checked me in, was very kind, greeting me by name with a smile every morning. It has been years since I stayed in a hotel with service of this exceptional quality. I will definitely stay here when I return to New Orleans and recommend it to everyone I know. The service at the Renaissance Arts Hotel went well beyond the normal expectations of Southern hospitalityâ€”it was truly excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place To Stay In A Great Location”
Reviews.Author: majik48
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice clean hotel where the employees give great service. The location is good because you are between the French Quarter and Uptown.

Reviews.Title: “Looking Forward To My Next Visit”
Reviews.Author: neworleanslady70
Reviews.Content: In June, 2008, my family booked a mini getaway at the hotel based on a recommendation. IWe were pleasantly surprised. Though my family HATE hotels (smell, filth, etc.), we look forward to another visit. The staff was pleasant, courteous and accommodating, and the rooms and bathrooms were CLEAN. I love the all white linen. For the first time EVER, I had a restful night - comfortable bed (KING). The overall atmosphere and experience was GREAT. We were so impressed w/ the hotel, we want to visit other Marriots (JAZZ,etc.) to compare.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the Essence Festival!”
Reviews.Author: Ontheg0123
Reviews.Content: Anyone attending the Essence Festival will find the majority of events within walking distance. You can enjoy the festivities and then retire to the Renaissance where it is pretty silent. I liked my room last year so much I asked for it again this year. The hotel gave me the same room-- modern, roomy, exposed brick, views and clean! Not bad for someone who travels up to 50% of the time and finds that quality rooms arent always easy to find. As well, the inside of the hotel features art works throughout, with a full art exhibit on the first floor---just beautiful! The staff is willing to help make my stay enjoyable, which is always a nice addition.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel - Sub-par Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Corner1002
Reviews.Content: Very nice, modern hotel. Beautiful public areas and rooms. Comfortable bed. Roof-top Pool. Great Value (we paid ~$100 per night). Pleasant, helpful staff (they provided many maps, cabs, and directions for us). We stayed at the Rennaissance Arts for 2 nights in June 2008. It was out first visit to New Orleans and the hotel was much better than we expected, bright, modern, clean, and a fairly good location. You are about 3 blocks south of St. Charles Street (and the St. Charles Street trolley car which winds through the Garden District). You are a 15 minute walk or $7 cab ride from the French Quarter, close enough to be totally convenient, yet far enough to offer a nice respite each evening. One block west of the hotel (literally 1 block, less 3 min walk) is Emeril's restaurant. Two blocks east (5 min walk) is a really cute wine bar "W.I.N.O" (Wine Institue of New Orleans). Two blocks south (5 min walk) is the Riverfront Dining and Shopping mall. The only sub-par feature of the hotel is that the hotel restaurant simply can't compete with NOLA cuisine. We had drinks and dessert there one evening and I think it was probably the worst bread pudding in all of New Orleans. But there are so many other places to eat in NOLA, why would you want to eat in your restaurant anyway?

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Room, Chic space”
Reviews.Author: DAL504
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently on a work trip. The hotel was pretty cool as it had a variety of art pieces throughout the location and in each of the rooms. This hotel is in the warehouse district and within walking distance to some great restaurants a coffee shop and galleries galore. Also, not too far off from the Quarter. The workout room on the top floor was nice and well apportioned and the pool (also on the top floor) had nice views of the city/river. Comfortable - but a little pricey compared to what you can get in other parts of the CBD/downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, even w/minor issues”
Reviews.Author: FiveStarTraveler
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our second trip to New Orleans and the Renaissance Arts. Since our last trip was 9 months after Katrina, we could not wait to return to enjoy the area even more. Let me begin on a positive note and say the rooms are beautifully decorated, clean and comfortable and lobby area very attractive. Staff also is very nice and accommodating. No issues with valet parking. We also choose this hotel because of itâ€™s roof top pool which is a nice way to relax during the day and soak up the sun. The hotel is also not so close to the â€œactionâ€� and in a more quiet area but within walking distance of everything. We did order from room service which was just o.k. Did order drinks from the bar to take up to the pool which were great. No complaints there. Now the negativeâ€¦ We began the first 2 nights of our 10 day trip at the Renaissance.
