Immediately we noticed issues with our air conditioning and reported the problem. Were told it was fixed but when we returned later that evening it was not. The following day the same thing but were told it had been fixed. Sleeping in 70 degree weather, when you have set youâ€™re a/c for 60 is not our idea of comfort. During the two days, all we heard was, Iâ€™m so sorry, Iâ€™m so sorry and the problem was fixed. We returned the following weekend for the last night of our trip, were upgraded to an inside suite which was nice, but truthfully how much time do you spend in your room? Unfortunately, same issue all over again, a 70 degree room with humidity. Once again, continued, Iâ€™m sorry. Doesnâ€™t cut it when you are on vacation. Aside from that constant annoyance if you are one who prefers to sleep in cool comfort, we do love the hotel and location and would more than likely stay there again in the future if traveling back to New Orleans as all the other positives about the property outweigh our a/c issues.

Reviews.Title: “Loved New Orleans with kids”
Reviews.Author: GingerWestHills
Reviews.Content: We loved New Orleans especially with our two children (ages 14 & 12). If you avoided Bourbon Street at night there are lots of fun family things to do. My son (14) thought the Tabasco Factory was great and the country store the best for tasting. The adults enjoyed the Jungle Gardens next to the factory. My daughter loved the Mari Gras museum, zoo and the shopping. We all loved the great food, music and gardens. The Renaissance Arts Hotel is in a safe, quiet area of New Orleans. About a 10-15 minute walk to the French Quarter made it a great location. Take the trolley and get there faster and in style but buy a pass do not do it the expensive way that we did by paying as we went. The hotel was pretty and unique with the art displayed around the lobby. As with other experiences with Marriott our reservations were not correct. I had called three times (I will spare you the details on why I did not trust the reservation system) for adjoining roomsâ€™ confirmation. Of course when we checked in the first set of rooms were on different floors, second set across the hall, third set had two king beds (would not work with a boy and girl), we were offered a cot but not after all the Marriott points we spent to get two rooms. Finally after waiting ten minutes outside the room (the bell hop was so kind) we were placed on the concierge floor with rooms side by side. I was told on check-in that Silver Elite Member did not qualify for any services on the concierge floor but we took the rooms willing. I was uncomfortable with not having a door to check on the kids but it worked out. It was really nice to have the drinks and breakfast in the lounge with the children. Beside the confusion and aggravation on check-in the staff was very helpful and attentive. The hotel was very clean and we never had a housekeeping problem. The business center was bothersome as you could not download (even to your own jump drive) or print. The front desk staff was great and let me print from their computer. We all loved New Orleans and hope to return very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Experience”
Reviews.Author: lasocialworker
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel! Wonderful for those who like the energy of New Orleans, but not the chaos of the French Quarter. Close enough for a long stroll to get there, but far enough away that you don't have to experience it if you don't want to. Excellent restaurants within walking distance and many art galleries. Will be staying at this one again!

Reviews.Title: “Truly Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: lismatisse
Reviews.Content: This hotel lives up to its name. It is like staying in an art gallery. Art in the rooms, lobby, restaurant and a sculpture garden inside. We stayed for 5 nights in an interior view room which was very quiet. I booked through the Marriott site and received breakfast with the stay. Quite a deal! The hotel staff was all very helpful and we enjoyed the spectacular rooftop pool/spa. I was attending a conference at the convention center and this hotel was a short 5 block walk -very accessible. The only downside would be the price for parking, but this was similar at other area hotels.

Reviews.Title: “A fine hotel!”
Reviews.Author: hondotank
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to stay in the Arts District and we couldn't have been more pleased. This hotel, part of the Marriot chain, is a wonderful redo of a warehouse in an up and coming area of New Orleans. The hotel is set up to show off local art and it does that well, with courtyards of sculpture to beautiful blown glass lighting to the water feature in the lobby to painting on many of the walls. The carpeting was brightly colored and added to the look I would call very hip. I must say that I did book this through Priceline for under $70 so that enhances my appreciation. There are five floors total and we were on the fourth. Our room was roomy enough and had a very good bed and nice chairs. The bath, though small, was nicely appointed with a granite counter and Kohler fixtures. Everything was clean and new looking. Towels were nice and thick. There was a coffeemaker, safe and a fridge that we did not use. Internet was around $12 a day but one could use the hotel computers free in a room off the lobby. Valet parking is $28 a day but on weekends one can park at the meters around the hotel free of charge. Emerils Restaurant is 1 block away, Mothers (on Poydras) and Harrahs are 3-4 blocks and the Quarter is another 3-4 blocks beyond that. We walk a lot so that wasn't a problem. While we couldn't hear any street noise, you could hear conversations (barely) next door so I question how much insulation/soundproofing is between rooms. The elevators ran well and smoothly and one always seemed to be open and ready to go on the lobby level. There was a pool/hot tub on the roof that we didn't get to try. I also saw a fitness room on one of the floors. All and all we had a good experience at the Renaissance Arts and would recommend it to anyone and would definitely go back. One last thing, 2 blocks away there is a glass blowing studio on Magazine St. (where the lobby light fixtures were created ) that has some incredible works displayed. You can also watch glassblowers at work and I even signed up for a 2 hour glass and made a paperweight and a small vase. Very fun!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed...”
Reviews.Author: Lemora
Reviews.Content: On our first night at approx 5AM we were woken up by kids running, screaming and playing in the hallways - opening and shutting exit doors and running up and down the stairs. We called the front desk and they said they would send security but the noise never stopped. (Apparently there was a cheerleading competition in town and a bus full arrived in the early AM and literally took over the hotel - where were the adults that should have been monitoring them??). The noise carried on into the morning and throughout the day. We spoke with the front desk and the clerk did comp our breakfast but said nothing could be done and that 'they were leaving Sunday'. We were on this trip for our anniversary and as you can imagine this but a serious damper on it. Please note - we informed the staff that it was our anniversary and requested a quiet room long before we arrived. I understand that large groups can take over the hotel and that it isn't the hotel staffs job to monitor them but certainly they could have done more - like speak with the adult(s) in charge and let them know there were compaints of kids running wild.... Overall this ruined our day as we had little sleep and no energy to do anything. We tried to rest in the room during the day the noise and kids running literally up and down the halls was still happening. We actually ended up getting a room at a different hotel that evening rather than deal with noise and lack of sleep again. In general the walls seemed to be really thin. We could hear our neighbors TV like we were in the same room and anytime anyone above or around us showered, it sounded like they were in our room. Another issue - we had asked for a refrigerator - well in advance of our arrival. Upon check in we were told it would be brought up by housekeeping. It never was and we never heard another thing about it. Frankly, while it was the least of our concerns it was still a disappointment never to hear anything else about it. Room condition - the bathroom didn't seem entirely clean and there were actually long hairs on two of the towels and the glasses looked dirty. There was a huge black stain on the carpet near the left side of the bed. The room itself was huge and the bed & bedding were very comfy and the office chair and stuffed lounge chair were both in new condition. On the exterior it looks like a nice hotel - the lobby & room decor was certainly nice enough, however, there is more to a '4 star' hotel than dressing it up. On a positive note we enjoyed the restaurant - great food & service. And to be fair the front desk clerks were always nice enough but never offered and real solutions or went out of the way to fix the problems.

Reviews.Title: “Professional and stylish stay”
Reviews.Author: canmark
Reviews.Content: The hotel is built in a refurbished warehouse in the Warehouse/Arts District, a short walk from the casino, French Quarter, CBD and Convention Center. Rooms and public areas are tastefully decorated without being overdone as at some boutique hotels. The expected Renaissance/Marriott-calibre furnishings and service, a decent restaurant (La Cote Brasserie), fairly well-lit and safe (albeit quiet) neighborhood is only a block away from Emeril's restaurant, yet away from the hubub of Canal Street/French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “need some customer service education”
Reviews.Author: Vaca08
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect if you are do not want the added expense of renting a car. There was a club room on our floor with a complimentary breakfast that we enjoyed the first day there. The second day, we were told we were not entitled to it and that we had to "Leave Now". No explanation, no attempt to find out the cost and add it to our room ,just "OUT" in mid mouthful! I had to call the front desk to because at 3pm our room was not yet cleaned , and I was asked it I had the do not disturb sign on my door. No attempt to apologize for the poor service. The staff filling the towel cabinet for the pool had a boom box playing loud hip hop music on completely drowning out the pleasant sound of the jazz coming from the speakers. Our room was average, our floor was very quiet, the carpet and bedding were a little stained. Not really a 4 star hotel in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Winner!!!!”
Reviews.Author: alonsocyn
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked a last minute hotel room in New Orleans through Priceline.com. We were traveling from Houston to Tennessee and decided t o stop in New Orleans for a little gambling so we only needed to sleep for a few hours. We got a great deal and where definitely surprised by the hotel. The hotel's decor was very trendy sort of boutiquey and the rooms are spacious, another perk - the hotel smells clean. The location is away from the center of the French Quarter but only a short walking distance away. The hotel is located in the Warehouse/Art district - the chic area in New Orleans, here you'll find trendy bars and pubs, and I'm sure other interesting stores. We didn't have much time but we plan on going back and checking this area out. You won't find victorian furniture or golden decor but it's worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Funky And Artsy Warehouse District Hotel”
Reviews.Author: matt5217
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a family event. My sister in law picked this hotel for all of us based on proximity to the Children's Museum and its amenities. It's been recently renovated and has a cool hipness unlike a typical Marriott hotel. It feels more like a small independent boutique hotel, or a Klimpton property. Our reception was warm and friendly, the rooms are average sized but very nicely outfitted and the location is great if you want to be centrally located, but in a quiet location. I would stay here again if my budget permitted. We also had a dinner for about 50 in the restaurant. While the food was decent, they obviously struggled to provide banquet style service in the a la carte service area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice features, but careless cleaning”
Reviews.Author: ant0725
Reviews.Content: Looks very nice, fun artwork, nice lobby. Close enough to walk to the French Quarter, Bourbon Street, etc. Marginal cleaning: I noticed after about 3 days that the glasses were being rinsed out and placed back on the shelf! Same with the coffee cups. I use cream & sugar - I noticed sugar residue on the cup after housekeeping had cleaned. Yuck. I stayed 6 nights - and the sheets were never changed - although I change sheets once/week at home. Guest services very responsive: I had a slow draining tub, a burnt out light bulb - these were fixed quickly. The front desk goofed up on my reservation (right dates via e-mail, wrong dates at the desk) and it took perseverance on my part to ensure I did get a room. I was initially told the hotel was booked and I'd have to move to another hotel for a couple nights out of the 6 nights I had reserved. Other than the cleaning problem - which is a big deal to me - the hotel was nice. Beds very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Under-Whelmed: Didn't Live Up to the Hype”
Reviews.Author: LaurenTraveler
Reviews.Content: When we made our reservation in July for a November stay, we requested the largest possible room with 2 beds. Once we arrived, we were escorted to a room that left a lot to be desired. The carpet was dull & stained & was rolling up in areas. There were nasty stains on both the duvet cover and the sheets. The room was geared for a handicap guest, which we are not. This meant a shorter vanity & a shower with a fold-down bench & hand-held nozzle (you couldn't get under the water hands-free). We requested a move and were given a regular room, with a regular shower, that was much cleaner without sacrificing much space. The room size was very impressive; important when you're sharing a room. Other Issues: The door didn't lock on our 2nd room; something that we didn't immediately notice. It was fixed promptly, but shouldn't have been an issue in the first place. The gold carpet, in every room that we saw is very worn, shabby & in need of replacement. The room decor is very modern & minimalist which didn't appeal to my travel companion. I like modern furnishings, but didn't find the hotel decorated to a 4-star level. Example: There was a large round table in front of the elevators on our floor & it was screaming for a flower arrangement, vase or piece of art. It looked odd because it was bare. As a matter of fact, there were no flowers displayed anywhere in this hotel. It is NOT a luxuriously appointed property, by any stretch of the imagination. For nearly $300/night, I expected more. We had a concierge level package and weren't very impressed with the offerings in the club room. The evening appetizers were limited & nothing special. The breakfast was a simple continental spread. Just OK. We did have access to sodas & bottled water, which was nice. We expected a concierge to be visible & available, but the desk was empty during our 5-day stay. The front desk staff was a mixed bag. We were not greeted warmly at all. Several staff members were friendly & accomodating & others displayed a complete lack of concern & enthusiasm. Example: When we switched rooms, we were not offered assistance (my traveling companion is elderly). The valet parking is over-priced at $28/day, but the valet staff were consistently nice & helpful to us & the service was fast & efficient. Don't expect Bath & Body Works toiletries. They are Lather products & are just OK. Our experience with the hotel restaurant/bar was very good. You must try their signature french toast for breakfast. It's wonderful! The location is perfect to access many things, but we found the walk to the French Quarter a bit far. Instead, we caught the trolley near the convention center (fun). I had high expectations after reading reviews on this site, but must say that I was disappointed & under-whelmed.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Renaissance Arts”
Reviews.Author: joshlufsgirl
Reviews.Content: This property was a really lovely place for us to come back after a crazy day of shopping on magazine street, drinking on Bourbon, seeing live music on Frenchman, or tromping around with Bloody Mary in city park. The front desk manager, Jared, was wonderful, and after hearing we were down there for my bachelorette-upgraded us to a suite. Our suite was gorgeously appointed with two bathrooms (!!!!which is a MUST for three girls all trying to get ready at the same time!!!!) and a view overlooking the interior courtyard. I did however peek into the normal rooms, and they were awesome as well, with brick walls and huge floor-to-ceiling windows. the pool on the roof was fantastic...we snuck into it LATE one evening (early next morning) and sat in the hottub chatting about how wonderful our little getaway was. I cannot wait to return to new orleans-and thankfully my job as a travel agent affords me the opportunity to do so... -kelly

Reviews.Title: “Superb Stay”
Reviews.Author: aaronfn
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner stayed at the Renaissance Arts Hotel in the last week of Sep 07 and loved it. I would give this hotel 4.5 stars but if pushed it was nearer a 5 than a 4. We picked the hotel based upon the trip adviser reviews (including comfort of bed), price, room size. The beds were amazingly comfortable and the rooms an excellent size. The hotel was very spacious and clean. The bar area was superb. People were often down there just talking to each other and enjoying drinks. We ate a couple of times at the adjoining restaurant (LaCÃ´te Brasserie). This was due to exhaustion from travelling. Having read some reviews on here we were not expecting much, so were blown away. The shrimp starter was out of this world. For a main we ordered the steak and it is probably one of the tastiest and best cooked steaks I have had. We ate and ordered after recommendations from other satisfied customers. Location wise, we enjoyed it. There are restaurants such as Emeril's, Cochon, Mulate's, Rio Mar all 2 minutes walking distance. There are also other highly regarded restaurants such as La Boca, Restaurant August within easy walking distance. Lucy's a great bar is opposite the hotel and especially good before a Saints game. The bar as discussed previously is lively and friendly, especially the bar man Bruce. Other close amenities include the aquarium, riverwalk shopping mall, Harrah's casino, Magazine Street and the streetcar from outside the Hilton (and Drago's restaurant for their charbroiled oysters) to the French Market in the French Quarter. The only slight negative for this hotel is if you wish to spend your entire holiday in the French Quarter (which would be a mistake anyway). The French Quarter and Bourbon Street are about 15 minutes walking distance but if you walk there and back daily as well as round the City it can become quite tiresome on the feet. Taxis however are only around Â£2 and even with a tip Â£3 isn't going to break the bank. Donald Trump has bought a site round the corner from The Renaissance Arts and the casino is round there so you're not in a location isolated from the centre We were weighing up 2 hotels in New Orleans. The other didn't have a roof top pool. I would say that is an essential. There were a few hours a day when we just wanted to relax and enjoy the sun. It was very hot and humid so some relaxing time in the sun with a breeze was heaven. I will be returning to New Orleans next year and will book the Renaissance again

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: panama0520
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night on 9/1/07. The lobby is very nice, I love the contemporary art pieces in the lobby. Check in was easy, the clerk was nice but not overly friendly. Our room was 417, and it faced Girod St. It's a cozy room, bed was very comfortable, I loved the bathroom decor (black and white). We had room service, the food was very good (we had the kobe burger and garden salad). It took less than 20 min to get our food. Price was typical of room service. Valet parking- $28. We didn't use our truck while we were there, thankfully because it took 30 min for them to bring us our truck when we were ready to leave. We ended up forgetting something in our room (face plate for our truck radio) and it ended up lost. Apparently whoever stripped the bed also went in the drawer where we had put it, took it, and they didn't turn it in to the lost and found. Security got involved, and we filed a report. Everyone was very nice and apologized to us several times. We don't think it will turn up, but at least they took the time to look in the room several times and question the housekeeping staff, and follow procedure. Overall this is a great hotel. It is removed from the FQ, but we didn't mind the walk (I was wearing heels too). We'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but Pricey”
Reviews.Author: SignalK
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Arts is a beautiful hotel with artwork abounding, as the name would imply. The rooms were clean and comfortable, if nothing out of the ordinary, but the beds and bedding were particularly cozy. Room features and hotel amenities were fairly standard for a hotel of this caliber. Location is convenient to the French Quarter. One nice "plus" is the pool and hot tub located on the roof. There is lots to choose from in New Orleans right now, however, and I would stay here again only if the price is right, as it was this time.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel every time”
Reviews.Author: 4vrongo
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel several times over the last two years taking our son to and from Tulane. It has always been a pleasant stay and the rooms and facilities exemplary. This past week our son was moving into an apt. for the first time and it wasn't ready but the hotel was able to accommodate changing our rooms at the last minute and were extremely pleasant about it. I think this is one of the better places to stay in New Orleans. We have stayed at several hotels and even though it is not as convenient for us as other hotels we still prefer to stay here. The french toast is extremely good.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with boutique feel”
Reviews.Author: chiefy29
Reviews.Content: Loved the Renaissance Arts! I agree with the other reviews and would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to visit New Orleans but not stay in the busy French Quarter. I wanted to add a few other things that have not been mentioned. We stayed over a long weekend and there was plenty of street parking available. There was also a $12/day parking lot less than 2 blocks away. Just be aware that it's not $12 for 24 hours, but $12 until 6am the next day. So there were options available other than the $28/day hotel parking. Maybe it's harder to use those options during the week or in busier times of the year - I don't know for sure. The staff was great, but oddly enough we never saw a concierge during our trip. We usually like to rely on the concierge for recommnedations/information and missed having one available.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Stay”
Reviews.Author: RickyC
Reviews.Content: Just returned from New Orleans attending a conference at the Convention Center. Fortunately, my school district booked us at the Rennaissance Arts, which turned out to be one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. The rooms are very spacious, and my king-sized bed made me feel like just that--a king! The bed had really high-quality sheets. a duvet and a comforter and had about 6 pillows. Plenty of closet space and a large bathroom with a great shower and nice bath supplies. One of the best features of the hotel is the central location. You can get to the Riverwalk and Convention Center on foot in 5 minutes or the French Quarter in about 10-15 minutes. We found the restaurant to be wonderful, albeit a bit pricey, and the bartenders mixed some great cocktails. All in all, I would highly recommend this hotel for business travelers or anyone who wants to have a great, relaxing vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: smitty2305
Reviews.Content: I travel to New Orleans regularly on business and this will be my first choice from now on. Courteous and attentive service from the moment I pulled up to valet. Very clean room and above average workout facility. Rooftop pool and hot tub was a nice touch - good view of the city for a 5 story builiding. Since I travel alone, I usually eat at the bar - experience was great there too; try the Kobe Beef Burger. Walking distance to casino and riverfront as well; this hotel is total package.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, very luxurious”
Reviews.Author: Nikless
Reviews.Content: We just returned from New Orleans. The Renaissance Arts was beautiful, the rooms were very clean and comfortable, and the service was great. I truly felt indulged with the wonderful linens, comfortable bed, and all the personal amenities in the room. Only disappointment was no free internet. It didn't really matter for this trip since it was pure pleasure. Guess that just goes to show you shouldn't go to New Orleans with work on your mind - only pleasure! Hats Off To All Who Are Working To Rebuild This Beautiful City And The Great Hospitality You Offer In The Face Of Everything!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, OK Service at the Renaissance Arts Hotel”
Reviews.Author: naturboy20
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Arts Hotel (RAH) has a great location. You are only blocks from everything you could need (outside of the French Quarter). I stayed here for business one night and was surprised at the activity on the streets for a Wednesday evening. The hotel is 2 blocks north of Emerils and the blocks between are lined with resturaunts. The lobby is different in that it is covered in unique art (Chihuly, etc.) and this gives it a unique feel. It also seemed that most of the guests at the hotel were younger for the class of hotel and seemed to be in their late 20's, early 30's. The only things I have to complain about is that parking is via valet only ($28/night) and the staff seemed inexperienced and not that inviting.

Reviews.Title: “great boutique hotel outside the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: aerofl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three nights at the Renaissance Arts Hotel in March. We were in town for a convention and chose not to stay in the mega convention hotel with the rest of our group. We looked on TA for a hotel located between the Convention Center and the French Quarter with some charm and character, more of a boutique hotel style. The trip from the airport was about 20 minutes and te drive had no difficulty locating the hotel on Tchoupitoulas St. Upon entering the lobby, we were impressed by the artwork everywhere - Dale Chihuly light fixtures, a gallery of artwork past the front desk, a sculpture garden - it all gave you a great first impression. Check-in was quick, efficient and friendly and we were on our way to our room on the second floor within a few short minutes. The room was relatively large by city hotel standards. Very high ceilings with exposed brick walls and a view over Tchoupitoulas St. below. Thought we might have a noise problem from the street, but it was whisper quiet in our room the whole stay. The room was well furnished - Marriott's great "Revive" bed with luxurious linen, plenty of pillow, an overstuffed chair with ottoman and side table, work desk with task chair, armoir with TV, etc. There was a charge for internet access - I believe hotels should just include that fee in the room price (even if they can then call it "free"). The armoire had a refrigerator that was tagged "not for use" (it must have been a former minibar), but we were able to obtain a key and use it quite adequately as a wine cooler. The bathroom was a bit small, but wellequiped - plentiful, lush towels, a nice selection of toiletries, good water pressure and plenty of water. A real hairdryer with plenty of power. Although housekeepng kept the room spotlessly clean, the one morning I requested a specific cleaning time while shopping in the French Quarter was not honored. When I returned and spoke to the Front Desk, they assured me it would be done within the hour and they would come into the rsstaurant to tell me it was finished. Room was cleaned, but no one told me. The restaurant itself (La Cote Brasserie) has a few issues. I though it was pretty ordinary for a hotel restaurant - decent enough food with a nod to New Orleans specialties, but slow waitstaff even on a quiet day. Also, they need to pay more attention to details - cleared table with napkins left on the floor, smashed potato chips under tables, smeared, dirty window overlooking the street. We thought the staff was trying very hard to meet our needs. The Concierge wasn't available most of our stay, so we dealt with the Front Desk employees mostly. Sent me to a spectacular needlepoint shop in the French Quarter, though couldn't seem to order a cab one night (snagged our own around the corner). Love that New Orleans is coming back, though it will be a long journey. Would recommend this hotel to friends and family - close enough to the French Quarter for a pleasant stroll, far enough away from the craziness. It really is a charming hotel, the management just need to pay a bit more attention to details.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, horrible restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Wootie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance Arts hotel from March 15-18th. The hotel is wonderful. The rooms are huge, clean and well equipped. The bathroom was clean and big as well. The hotel was very stylish and our room was whisper quiet. I loved the location--it's just a couple blocks from great restaurances like Tommys, August, Lucy's. The walk to the French quarter was easy. We had gorgeous weather. The hotel arranged taxis for us, greeted us like valued guests. Great place. The hotel restaurant is awful, though. Bot the food and service were really bad. But there are so many great places to eat around there that it doesn't matter.

Reviews.Title: “A Really Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lisa C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance Arts hotel during our week-long stay in New Orleans last December. The hotel was a bit far from the French Quarter, but the walk is totally manageable. We ran into a few panhandlers when we crossed Canal, but they weren't too aggressive. The beds at the Renaissance were very comfortable, the room was quiet, and the gym provides free towels. The only negatives I would mention are the valet-only parking fees, which seemed a bit steep if you're not on a corporate account, and their charge for Internet access. The valet parking attendants themselves were great and we really appreciated their help in giving directions, but we wish the costs were a bit lower. Overall, a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC Stay in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: jcdato
Reviews.Content: We stayed for Mardi Gras 2007; as a seasoned MG veteran, I chose this hotel primarily for location and its easy access to Uptown New Orleans. Someone looking for quick access to Bourbon should look elsewhere; however, the walk is easy and totally safe. The rooms and bedding are completely plush and comfortable and the decor impeccable. The lobby and restaurant/bar are chic and beautiful! My party and I cannot say enough about the truly wonderful staff of this hotel! All were totally professional, friendly and extremely helpful! THIS IS A GREAT STAY! I personally guarantee it!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel, Horrible Management”
Reviews.Author: macnalex26
Reviews.Content: As a Marriott Platinum member, I am accustomed to my stays at Marriott's hotels (Renaissance is owned by Marriott) being exceptionally good. This hotel's decor is stunning, the rooms are well-appointed and spacious, and the bedding is Marriott's newest and like sleeping in a cloud. The hotel has a small number of suites, and I stayed in one of these for most of my stay. Compared to the standard guest room, the suites are certainly more spacious, particularly the bathrooms, but if you are looking for elegant or luxurious, the suites are simply not so. Unless you get an automatic upgrade, don't waste the money. I have ranked this hotel so low because the management made my experience here terrible. The two-faced way in which they deal with their guests is shocking, and I discovered that the details of my account were discussed among the staff and other guests. My privacy was violated by this hotel in the worst ways, so if you are a business traveler or confidentiality is of importance to you, this hotel cares little for your privacy. And the management seems to encourage this conduct. Beautiful hotel, but needs a new staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: haji
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel tucked away in a quiter part of New Orleans than the Quarter. The hotel common areas were very nicely decorated with artwork and sculpture. The bar/restaurant had friendly staff and good food that wasn't terribly overpriced like most hotel restaurants. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. The hotel is about a 15-20 minute walk from the French Quarter and about a 5 minute walk from Harrah's. Not a lot of restaurants and activity right out the front door of the hotel, but that is what makes it a nice place to stay. The only downside to the hotel was the lounge. The food in the lounge was minimal, not real tasty, and seemed like bulk warehouse bought pastries and such. Also, there was no internet connection in the lounge. This was the only thing to give it four stars instead of five.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Lesleyandy
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a convention in New Orleans and had a fabulous stay at the Renissance Arts! We stayed based on excellent Tripadvisor reviews that were 100% on the money! The location was ideal as it is a 10 minute walk to the Convention Center, close to several museums and the St. Charles Streetcar line, and a 15 minute walk to the French Quarter. We liked being able to come back to a neighborhood that was lively, but more relaxed and quiet than the craziness of the French Quarter! This hotel had the atmosphere of a boutique hotel with artsy modern design and furniture. The rooms are big and we felt very relaxed with ample amenities. Tall windows faced the street, making the room airy and bright. The bed was comfortable with soft linen. The bathroom is small but well designed with plenty of counter space (nice smelling shampoo and lotion too!). The staff was friendly and super helpful. At the hotel (and all around New Orleans) there was plenty of Southern hospitality and we were told more than once by employees that they were appreciative of the desperately needed business tourists bring to this recovering city. We had a tasty breakfast and delicious snacks in the La Cote Brasserie on the hotel's first floor which is much better than a typical hotel eatery. Mother's, famous for po' boys was two blocks away where we had a huge southern style breakfast and tasty sandwich lunch. Red Fish Grill (casual, moderate$) and G.W. Fin's (dressy, $$ but worth every penny) are within walking distance in the French Quarter. Both had excellent seafood and great service. In all, highly recommended for great location and accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Taffeta
Reviews.Content: I hadn't been to the Warehouse Arts district of New Orleans for several years. It becomes more and more interesting with art galleries, restaurants, and wonderful hotels - especially the Renaissance Arts. My luggage was lost on the way to N.O., and the hotel staff could not have been more helpful in giving me as many necessary items as they could, in directing me to the nearest Walgreens to buy more, and in doing all they could to make the stay as pleasant as possible. I didn't get my luggage until only a day before leaving, but was not too concerned about it, partly due to the efforts of the hotel staff to ensure my comfort. The room was extra wide and roomy for one person. All fixtures and equipment worked well. The cotton robe was very much appreciated! The bed was very comfortable. The hotel was quiet -- my room looked out on an internal atrium, not on the street. The hotel restaurant was excellent -- the creme brulee is recommended for dessert. It was one of the best I've tasted. The Renaissance Arts is just a few blocks from the French Quarter, Canal Street, the Convention Center, and the Mississippi River. It is in a converted warehouse, and the renovation must be fairly recent because everything looks very new and clean. There is modern artwork hanging all over, and some beautiful glass chandeliers in the lobby that look like they could have been designed by Dale Chihuly. Overall, this is one of the best hotel stays I've experienced in a long time. I hope to stay there in the future, when my luggage is not lost. It would then be perfect!

Reviews.Title: “A Warehouse District Gem!”
Reviews.Author: brooklynlibrarian
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to New Orleans after Katrina. I wasn't sure what to expect but the Renaissance Arts is back in business providing an extremely pleasant home-away-from-home. It's just a few blocks from the Conference Center, close to the Central Business District and walking distance to Canal St. and the French Quarter. I'm a woman and felt confident walking to the hotel each night. This is the place if you like contemporary design and furniture. The linens on the comfortable bed are good, the room and public areas are decorated with original art and there's sculpture in the covered courtyard. The in-room safe is great, the bathroom is small but perfect and cotton robes hang in the closet. There are bright carpets in the public spaces that put a smile on your face. The staff was welcoming and helpful with everything from wake-up calls and taxi arrangements to being just plain friendly to tired travelers. Two elevators never allow more than a minute's wait. (I never realized how much time I spent waiting for hotel elevators.) The restaurant is many cuts about the normal chain hotel restaurant. The French toast and the coffee were lovely and the same price as the big hotels. There are many great restaurants in New Orleans but if you're in a hurry in the morning or just want to come back to the comfort of your hotel after a busy day you can eat well here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Comfortable, Quiet, Heaven!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife, 7-year-old and I stayed here right after they opened. It quickly became my favorite hotel in New Orleans. Far enough away from the Vieux Carre to be quiet at night, but close enought to walk to the quarter along the levee. I was worried there wouldn't be enough nearby for kids, but we were amazed -- we could walk to the Aquarium, the mall along the river, watch glass blowing at the art glass shop, the Holocost memorial...we were plenty busy. The room was a great size, beautifully appointed, even wonderful art in the bathroom! I especially liked the safe which was free to use, big enough to hold my laptop plus jewelry, passports, etc. Not to be missed are the art glass chandelliers by Dale Chiluly in the lobby. They are spectacular! I have worried about this hotel since Hurricane Katrina struck. My wife and I have already decided that the minute they reopen, we're booking another trip to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Hurricane Katrina”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were there on Sat 8/27/05 to 8/28/05. The hotel staff including the hotel manager were very kind and understanding. They helped us evacuate by limo to Memphis Tenn. Just 10 hours before all chaos broke out. I hope now they all were safe and thier homes aren't destroyed. I pray for them daily as they were as scarred as we were. God bless the Big Easy. Beautiful hotel with wonderful art work. Great customer skills and compassion. I'll be back one day!

Reviews.Title: “What a place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked this room via the internet on a "name your own price" type of site for about $110 per night. I was asked to speak at a convention, but had to pay my own way. Due to budget cuts in my department, I was told I could go if I kept it "really cheap". Have you priced the hotels in New Orleans? Most run >$225 per night. This hotel was in a great location. A 7 minute walk to the convention center and the French Quarter. I felt completely at ease walking by myself, even at dusk. The room was spacious, clean, well appointed, and functional. You can slide a laptop into the room safe with ease. There were several resturaunts in the area (many famous for their local dishes). I was, unfortunately, unable to sample the resturaunt in the hotel. Most importantly, despite what you hear about hotel staff treating guests that book thru discount sites "differently", I was happy to find the staff always very helpful. Directions and maps were provided when I asked a general question. And when a housekeeper walking in the hall noticed that I was struggling to open my door with laptop and purse, she offered to help. Should I find myself in New Orleans again, this is where I'll stay!

Reviews.Title: “above avg- no more no less-”
Reviews.Author: tomay
Reviews.Content: just returned from a 3 night stay- i will rate stay at above average but just barely-hotel nice. lobby clean, front desk helpful, pool and hot tub on roof clean- "too open" though need some foliage up there (rooftop)- if you go you will see what i mean- rooms again fairly clean, i am just not particularly impressed- i really expected more- i've stayed in other places in this price renage and even lower where i felt i had a better experience- again nothing to really complain about- just didn't meet my expectations- and there are a whole lot of choices in new orleans- nothing at renaissance arts hotel has me feeling like i would make an effort to go back

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RendezvousSpot
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the Renaissance Arts Hotel for 3 days during the Essence Music Festival. I wanted to stay at The W, but it was booked by the time I was able to get everyone to agree to go to the Festival. I was thoroughly impressed by the hotel. During our stay I visited the other hotels in the area and they were so congested that it was hard to even get into your room and some you had to show your room key just to get in. I think that this was and excellent choice of hotel because of the location, cleanliness, staff support, and less confusion. The only gripe we had was that the restaurant was not the best. Mrs. Carter and Q helped us with our every need and did not once give us an ugly look as to we were getting on their nerves. If you are looking for a quiet non-congested hotel in walking distance to the hustle and bustle of the BIG EASY this is the hotel for you. I will most definitely will stay here next year.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our four-night stay at the Renaissance Arts Hotel in the Warehouse District in May couldn't have been better. The hotel, a delightfully refurbished warehouse, is gorgeous with its clean, sleek lines and amazing art work throughout. Our room was first-class in decor, cleanliness, wonderfully comfy beds and extras to pamper us. Service was friendly and impeccable, from desk staff to valets to restaurant and bar staff. We've stayed in some great hotels over the years and the Arts Hotel ranks among the very best. And, best of all, we stayed there at the shockingly affordable internet-special rate of $79 per night, plus $25 for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay as good as the first”
Reviews.Author: Crankee
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Renaissance Arts May 27-30, and found this stay to be every bit as pleasant as my December visit. The staff is accommodating and professional. Yes, it is a walk from this hotel to the FQ, so if you plan on making the FQ your focal point and don't like to walk, I would suggest something closer to Canal or in the FQ. As mentioned in another review, the streets are deserted late at night so I advise taking a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: trav05
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 2 nights, paid for the concierge level room which gives access to the lounge with goodies and beverages. Had requested 2 dbl beds, but was given a king bedrm suite with a pullout sofa. Also, had to return to the front desk to have room key recoded since it would not work on lounge door which I had paid for. Breakfast at the restaurant was expensive, but good. Rooms were quiet and clean. Hotel staff was accomodating and pleasant. Tommy's restaurant (1 block away) has good food and better prices and variety. Overrall a good stay and I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulously Hip!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel had everything we wanted while staying in New Orleans. Not too close to the action, but close enough to feel in the mix. Rooms are as nice (or nicer!!) as the W or the Monaco at HALF the price. Rooftop pool and jacuzzi couldn't have been better--soaking under the stars was gorgeous. Staff was courteous and helpful and room service was actually GOOD!! There is a fabulous sculpture gallery inside the hotel which is an interesting bonus and if you're there on a Saturday, there is an adorable farmer's market every Saturday morning around the corner from the hotel. Perfect!! We will defintely make this our New Orleans hotel from here on out. Thank you Renaissance Arts!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and attractive”
Reviews.Author: Slothrop
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a trip to the Jazzfest; my family (2 adults, 2 12 year olds) stayed at the Renaissance Arts. Very nice, comfortable, attractive hotel. The first night we were given a room with windows on an interior atrium, not so nice; we asked to be moved to a room with exterior windows and that was no problem -- much better room. The rooms were slightly smaller than standard, but still fine. Nice furnishings, art on the walls, etc. Rooftop swimming pool was very pleasant. (The hottub, though, was at best lukewarm.) Had a late meal one night in the hotel restaurant which was excellent. One bad experience was that my daughter's swimsuit was mistakenly taken by the housekeeping staff and apparently thrown away; the hotel has agreed, however, to reimburse us for it. -- It's a bit of a walk to the French Quarter, but not too bad. One can also walk about 4 blocks to a trolley stop.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but not close!”
Reviews.Author: Janet F
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Renaissance for April 8-11th during the French Quarter Festival. The hotel is very clean and comfortable, and the staff is very helpful. But . . . altho' we enjoy walking, this hotel is a bit far from The French Quarter; once you've walked all day at the Festival and through The Quarter, it's a hike to get back to the hotel. We also found it too far to walk back, rest awhile, then want to walk back to the Quarter. We attend the Festival every year, and altho' this hotel is great, we will stay closer to the action next year.

Reviews.Title: “I found my Home in New Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: brdyboop
Reviews.Content: This hotel will always be my choice when I stay in New Orleans. It is 5 Star Hotel for a 3 Star price. The rooms are beautiful, clean and colorful. The people who work there are so helpful and friendly. The breakfast buffet on Easter Sunday was lovely and the food every other day downstaris was excellent. We always had someone to arrange a cab, offer suggestions for resturants, help with anything we needed. If you love New Orleans, this place will only make you love it more!! Ill never bother to look elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “What a treat”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel while at a conference in NOLA. I had a great, quiet room with an amazingly comfortable bed. Rooms are nicely furnished and the staff is extremely helpful and friendly. The location is quite good, being convenient to both the convention center and the french quarter. I would definitely stay here again. 5 stars!
